Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Floral and toasty aromas top beautiful fruit and baking-spice flavors in this bold but nicely layered and concentrated wine. This is the richest of Starfield's stand-out 2019 whites, showing an expansive mouthfeel and slowly resonating flavors that lead to a lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Starfield 2019 Estate Grown Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This rich, full-bodied wine is packed with ripe pears, butter, vanilla and toasted almonds without going absolutely over the top. Plenty of overt fruitiness is well-matched by juicy acidity for good balance and a sense of freshness. Best from 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Drew 2018 Valenti Ranch Viognier (Mendocino Ridge)

Appellation: Fountaingrove District, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A 100% varietal wine aged in stainless-steel barrels, this white is waxy and earthy, tasting of apple skin, apricot and nectarine. A steely backbone preserves freshness and a crispness to the texture, showing a well-balanced approach.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Bricoleur 2019 Kick Ranch Vineyard Viognier (Fountaingrove District)

Appellation: Bennett Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Lush, vibrant and elongated on the palate, this impressive white from the cooler climes of Sonoma is juicy and fresh in nectarine, apricot and orange.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Flanagan 2019 Viognier (Bennett Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Creamy aromas of baked peach, soft caramel and apricot blossom make for an engaging nose on this bottling. It's clean, crisp and chalky on the palate, where Key lime blossom and strongly mineral tones make for a very clean and focused experience.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Donati Family Vineyard 2019 Family Reserve Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a zesty citrus edge to the rounded peach middle on the nose of this very cleanly made wine. A firm tension frames the sip, where a steel minerality cuts through the lime-peel flavors, with an acidity pumping into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Jaffurs 2019 Bien Nacido Vineyard Viognier (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a zesty citrus edge to the rounded peach middle on the nose of this very cleanly made wine. A firm tension frames the sip, where a steel minerality cuts through the lime-peel flavors, with an acidity pumping into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Jaffurs 2019 Bien Nacido Vineyard Viognier (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine opens with bright aromas of peach and jasmine. Orange peel, apricot and more peach continue on the cohesive palate, making this a balanced wine with wide appeal.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Kunde 2019 Destination Series Estate Grown Viognier (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Côtes du Lot, Southwest France, France
Description: From a vineyard planted in 2004, this wine is rich and full. Apricot and spice flavors dominate the opulent wine, with a touch of mineral texture. It is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de Cause 2018 La Lande Cavagnac Viognier (Côtes du Lot)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A toasted and salted cashew aroma meets with apricot and peach syrup accents on the nose of this bottling. The rounded stone-fruit flavors come through on the sip as well, but are held in check by the lanolin-like elements.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Glunz 2019 White Hawk Vineyard Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Tasting of fresh apricot within a floral, steely frame, this impressive white is fuller bodied in style, creamy and lush on the midpalate without getting overburdened by the weight. It is made by Ryan Kunde, the son of beloved grape grower Saralee Kunde, who planted Catie's Corner.                      Virginie Boone
Name: DRNK 2018 Catie's Corner Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Powerful and perfumed, this silky-tipped Viognier balances streaks of honey and cream against pristine apricot and white-peach flavors. It's a mouthclinging wine, with a warming finish accented by smoke, schist and rose petals. It's at peak now through 2027 but will hold further.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dauvergne & Ranvier 2019 Vin Rare  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Cream and honey drench the palate of this Viognier. It's a massive, almost corpulent, wine aged nine months in used French oak but also has a core of glimmering apricot and honeydew flavors. The finish is long and waxy, lingering on a kiss of smoke and vanilla. A decadent wine, it's ready now but should develop more earthen subtleties through 2028.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Louis Chèze 2018 Pagus Luminus  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Heady notes of burnt caramel and char introduce this lavishly oaked but tangerine-kissed Viognier. Matured eight months on its lees in barrel, it's a rich, glycerol sip with concentrated flavors of white-peach nectar and honeysuckle freshened by a delicate mineral spine and smoky finish. Best enjoyed now–2026.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Benjamin et David Duclaux 2019 Les Caillets  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Crisp green apples and melon are dusted with white pepper and crushed asphalt in this satiny white. Sourced from 25-year-old Viognier vines and matured 10 months in French oak, it's a weighty, viscous wine lifted by chalky minerality and a fresh tangerine finish. Best enjoyed now–2026.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Graeme & Julie Bott 2018  Condrieu

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: The nose of this wine is subtle and earthen, taking more time to open than its ebulliently perfumed, showstopper peers in Condrieu. But with time and aeration, it reveals glimpses of apricot and orange mousse, along with a breath of white flowers. Full bodied yet freshly balanced, it highlights primary peach and yellow-cherry flavors kissed by toast and vanilla. It's ready to drink now and best enjoyed through 2026.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Maison Denuzière 2018 J. Denuzière  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the inaugural vintage of this wine, coming from high up on Red Mountain. Aromas of pear, peach, lees and mineral are followed by textured fruit flavors that show a strong sense of vibrancy and, dare I say, minerality. The intensity, balance and length are impressive. It focuses on lees expression and texture rather than sheer varietal purity.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Liminal 2018 High Canyon Series WeatherEye Vineyard Viognier (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Eden Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: Yalumba's—and Australia's—best known Viognier is a medium-bodied, food-friendly number, if currently a bit jangly. The nose is bright and appealing with notes of lime blossom, ground ginger, and apple and peach still on the tree. The palate carries these flavors through to the finish, but the acidity and oak never quite knit together, nor is the texture interesting enough to get past it. Nevertheless, Viognier fans should enjoy the honeyed complexity this will gain with time. Drink 2022–2028.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Yalumba 2018 The Virgilius Viognier (Eden Valley)

Appellation: Mt. Harlan, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light mango, dried apple, lemon peel and a faint waft of seashore show on the nose of this bottling, from vines planted in 1983 and grown at 2,200 feet. The palate is brisk with lime, lemon and tangerine-peel flavors that are a bit sour, and a lingering maritime funk permeates the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Calera 2018 Viognier (Mt. Harlan)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
Description: A contrast to the more viscous Northern Rhône expressions of Viognier, this slim, tangerine-kissed white balances a silky, sumptuous palate against an invigorating citrus lift. Bright and airy, it finishes with a mineral crush and lingering notes of crisp-tart peach and apricot.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Château du Trignon 2019 Viognier (Côtes du Rhône)

Appellation: Cape South Coast, South Africa
Description: This wine leads with a pretty floral vibrancy, expressed in waves of rose and white flower that are grounded by fruity tones of white peach, melon and sweet orange oil. It's medium-plus in weight, with a roundness to the palate that is buoyed by ample acidity and a lightly bitter texture that lends some framing through to the close. Drink now–2024.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Creation 2020 Viognier (Cape South Coast)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This earthy, savory wine offers aromas of dried figs and butterscotch that lead to mature, mouthcoating vanilla-bean and honey flavors. A full body and a rich, lingering aspect give it a quiet power.                      Jim Gordon
Name: The Winery SF 2018 Viognier (North Coast)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Strong aromas of peach blossom and light guava are clean while still being very tropical on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very broad and plush in flavors of honeysuckle, guava, papaya and mango.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Sculpterra 2019 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This dry, complex wine starts with salty, white peppery aromas followed by lean, spare apricot and peach-skin flavors on a rather light body. It is enjoyable for its savory, restrained qualities.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Mathew Gibson 2018 Bobbi's Estate Viognier (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Broad strokes of yellow apple and quince preserves introduce this freshly balanced Northern Rhône Viognier. While silky and supple on the palate, it's an unusually svelte, easy-drinking expression of Viognier. Flurries of dried mint, thyme and crushed stone lend earthen subtleties to the finish. At peak now–2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Anthony Paret 2018 Valvigneyre Viognier (Côtes du Rhône)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Fragrant floral aromas and bright, peachy flavors give this medium-bodied wine a generous, fruity appeal that matches a sweet-seeming balance.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bella Grace 2020 Viognier (Amador County)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Broad peach, pineapple and light mango aromas meet with a sharp citrus-zest streak and chalky minerality on the nose of this bottling. The palate is tightly wound, with a flinty, baking-soda-like minerality, which frames the sharp lime-peel and rounded peach flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Cooper-Garrod 2019 Randall Grahm Clone Viognier (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Very varietal aromas of rich peach, pear, spice and flower are followed by fuller-feeling but still restrained stone fruit flavors. The concrete egg fermenting shows, giving the wine pleasing mineral accents. It brings intriguing acidity for the variety. A long finish keeps the interest up.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Saviah 2019 Estate Vineyard Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Cowhorn's Viogniers invariably present themselves as concentrated, aromatic and loaded with citrusy highlights. This new reserve is no exception, with lemon rind and lemon curd among the full-bodied tree fruit flavors. It seems to have spent some time in new wood, bringing pretty flavors of vanilla wafer and butter cookie into the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Cowhorn 2019 Reserve Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe apple, pear, nectarine and apricot elements are cut by crisp and clean lime-peel and grapefruit-balm aromas on the nose of this bottling. The palate is tightly wound and chalky, with a lightly floral flavor carrying into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Paradise Springs 2019 Viognier (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Mineral-driven aromas of struck stone and dried earth lead into mint, lemon balm and peach blossom on the nose of this bottling. There's a sharp citrus tone to the sip, where mango and makrut lime flavors met with lemongrass and tart pineapple.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bottle Jack 2019 Viognier (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Seared peach, daffodil, stone-fruit blossoms and pineapple cream show on the nose of this bottling from the upper Carmel Valley. There's a steely minerality to the sip, where apple-blossom and tropical-flower aromas flex against a tight textural weave.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Boekenoogen 2018 Bell Ranch Vineyard Viognier (Monterey)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: This blossomy, floral wine offers jasmine, honeysuckle and peach backed by accents of lemon and pine. The palate lands softly, with a pillowy feel that's still adequately lifted by bright acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Bedell 2019 Viognier (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: This billowy white offers peach, apricot and white flower tones dusted in some bubblegum spice. There's good balance to it all, making it an enjoyable choice as an aperitif.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Pindar Vineyards 2019 Viognier (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This modestly fruity but mouthfilling wine is flavorful and well balanced. Mild butter and cream flavors mingle with Anjou pear and floral notes that are typical of the varietal.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sobon Estate 2019 Viognier (Amador County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe aromas of banana and mango bubblegum show on the rich nose of this bottling. Peach-custard and banana-pudding flavors come through on the fat palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Vahali 2019 Jhelum Estate Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Hints of sweet spice and smoke seep into sunny apricot and honeysuckle in this lavishly rounded Viognier. It's a classically fleshy, weighty wine with a delightfully clingy finish, but cutting mineral tones and crisp tangerine acidity lend lift and vitality, too. Excellent in youth but concentrated enough to mature well through 2040.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Château de Saint-Cosme 2018  Condrieu

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Spicy gingerbread tones and bright, luminous white peach and tangerine extend from nose to finish in this glossy, concentrated Condrieu. True to form, it's a classically zaftig sip packed densely with honeyed tropical fruit flavors and silken skeins of cream. Stunning in youth but structured enough to age beautifully through 2035 and likely further.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Rémi Niero 2018 Chéry  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This wine is bold and rich in texture, but complex and subtle in flavor, starting with attractive wax and lanolin aromas and leading to green fig, mineral and light tangerine on the palate. A tantalizing balance of fresh acidity against richness and a touch of maturity makes it all the more interesting.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sol Rouge 2018 Viognier (Lake County)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Heady aromas of toasted oak, smoke and spice introduce this rich, glycerol white. Filling the palate with waves of orange, cream and honeysuckle, it's a voluptuously textured, classic Condrieu with a pleasantly phenolic finish. Best enjoyed young before 2022 or set aside until close to 2030 to enjoy its more spicy, earthen complexities.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Anthony Paret 2017 Les Ceps du Nebadon  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Jasmine blossoms and white peach seduce on the nose of this lavishly fragrant dry white. Unctuous and creamy on the palate, it's a delightfully languorous sip that highlights Viognier's fresher, fruitier dimensions. It's irresistible in its youth, but cellaring till 2030 should bring out more savory complexities, too.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Delas Frères 2018 La Galopine  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Stainless-steel fermented, this steely 100% varietal wine impresses in its floral, earthy beginnings and balanced acidity. Apple-blossom, green-apple and Meyer lemon characteristics shine, leading to a wet stone-like texture and finishing note of grapefruit.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Anaba 2019 Landa Vineyard Viognier (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Whiffs of spring blossoms and freshly laundered linen entice on the nose of this opulent but freshly balanced white. It's a luscious, enveloping sip that floods the palate in swirls of sweet cream, honey and spice. The finish is a touch sappy in its youth but should meld out over the next decade. Enjoy now for its bold fruit and floral tones, or wait till 2028.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Delas Frères 2018 Clos Boucher  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Focused with pinpoint stone fruits atop bright acids, this is a fine version of a variety that's difficult to ripen perfectly. Some 28% was fermented in barrel, the rest in stainless steel. A scent of sweet spice brings further pleasure, but it's the rich, ripe fruit that shines most brightly.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: King Estate 2017 Viognier (Oregon)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: This full-bodied and complex wine offers floral, nutty aromas, flinty, figgy flavors and a nicely rich texture that is balanced by subdued acidity for a fresh mouthfeel.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Hyde Vineyard 2018 Estate Viognier (Carneros)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Opulent butter, vanilla and pineapple aromas lead to effusively fruity flavors that are generously spiced with pastry notes and a touch of toasted oak. The wine is rich, full and mouthfilling.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lava Cap 2019 Reserve Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fermented and aged in neutral barrels, this steely, elegant white shows a wealth of acidity and nuanced, stony texture. Flavors of green apple, melon and tangy butter combine well to make for a cohesive, balanced whole.                      Virginie Boone
Name: MacLaren 2019 Aida Gregori Vineyard Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Creamy in flavor and mouthfeel, this medium-bodied wine is like a liquid apple tart, offering vanilla, baked apple and croissant flavors on a rich, smooth texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Skinner 2019 Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: As in past vintages, three-quarters was fermented in concrete egg, the rest in a new puncheon. There's a not-unpleasant waxy feeling to the lemon and orange fruit, and the flavors plunge deeply down through the palate. It's a lively and persistent wine, which finishes with a slight burn.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Naumes 2018 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Creamy in flavor and mouthfeel, this medium-bodied wine is like a liquid apple tart, offering vanilla, baked apple and croissant flavors on a rich, smooth texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Skinner 2019 Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Bennett Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Opening in a crisp wave of Meyer lemon, this wine develops a creamy richness on the midpalate, lifted by plenty of fresh acidity. Green apple, melon and a whiff of peach round out the medium-bodied experience.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Flanagan 2018 Viognier (Bennett Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Examples of this variety are rare in Walla Walla Valley. Effusive aromas of pear, white peach and flower aromas are followed by ripe but initially compact peach flavors. It's equal parts intrigue and delivery.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Spring Valley Vineyard 2017 Estate Grown Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Sharp as a knife and layered with strong scents and flavors of citrus oils, skins and a mix of gin-like botanicals, this softens up a bit midpalate and brings in more citrus flavors, notably pineapple. It softens further in the finish, adding a touch of butterfat. It was aged 10 months in 10% new oak.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Griffin Creek 2018 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Petaluma Gap, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Hearty and honeyed, this is an amphorae wine, dark gold in color and earthy in mushroom. Stone fruit and apple mingle on the full-bodied palate, which is viscous and rich.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Jacuzzi 2018 Clarum Viognier (Petaluma Gap)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Mineral, peach skin and apricot are just a few of the aromatic nuances that give this full-bodied and well-balanced wine a fascinating Old World expression. Fresh acidity braces peach and apricot flavors while the mouthfeel broadens with each sip.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Terre Rouge 2018 Viognier (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crisp and fresh on the nose, this bottling begins with light honeysuckle and plumeria aromas that are held in place by a citrusy edge of Meyer lemon peel. That tension carries through the sip as well, where Anjou and Asian pear-flesh flavors are framed by a chalky backbone and a zesty Key lime acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Table Eleven 2019 Quail Valley Vineyard Viognier (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Placer County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Aromas of citrus flowers and flavors of ripe pear and marzipan make this full-bodied, barrel-fermented wine tempting and delicious. A creamy texture, good depth of flavor and lingering finish all contribute to its impressive quality.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Le Casque 2019 Damiano Vineyard Viognier (Placer County)

Appellation: Paso Robles Highlands District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Broad aromas of guava, melon, plumeria and jasmine show on the nose of this bottling. The real reward is the incredibly lively palate, where fresh, zesty acidity delivers clean flavors of pear rind and guava.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Crū 2019 French Camp Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles Highlands District)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A slightly dark shade of yellow in the glass, this late-harvest wine is full of melon, plumeria and wildflower honey on the nose. It's viscous and smooth on the palate, where acidity keeps the wine fresh as it grows thicker and sweeter, offering honey, mango-sorbet and creamy orange flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Designation: Late Harvest Rancho Rio Robles Vineyard
Name: Kaena 2017 Late Harvest Rancho Rio Robles Vineyard Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: San Diego County, South Coast, California, US
Description: Few San Diego County wineries are exploring the terroir as diligently as this family-run winery. This estate bottling is fresh yet rich, with light peach and creamy lemon aromas. The palate is clean and full, with more peach and apple-pie flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hungry Hawk 2019 Viognier (San Diego County)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Toasty aromas of baked nectarine, dried white flowers and light nuts show on the nose of this bottling. There's a line of alkalinity to the sip, where dried lime and orange-rind flavors meet with a hint of guava peel.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Sapien 2018 Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried apple and honeysuckle meet with lemon peel on the nose of this bottling from a regional Rhône pioneer. The palate is fresher, offering apple and pear flavors atop a persistent acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Zaca Mesa 2018 Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Expressive aromas of apricot, flower and jasmine are followed by full-bodied, plentiful stone-fruit flavors. It's weighty, but with ample acidity to keep it tied together.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Structure 2019 Oculus Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tightly woven aromas of dried lemon peel, ripe apple, a metallic minerality and a touch of nuts show on the nose of this bottling from Noah and Tamara Rowles' backyard vineyard. There's bright acidity on the palate, where flavors of ripe apple, melon and a hint of banana arise.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Dovecote 2018 Quail Valley Vineyard Estate Viognier (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Steely aromas of cold metal meet with a light hint of peach on the tightly wound nose of this bottling. That taut sense carries to the palate, which also offers more generous flavors of stewed pome fruit.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Dovecote 2019 Quail Valley Vineyard Viognier (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a very exuberant style of Viognier, from the aromatics and flavors to the acidity and texture. Aromas of peach, guava, tuberose and Stargazer lily kick off the nose, leading into a palate that is very fresh while loaded with bubblegum and guava flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Vina Robles 2019 Huerhuero Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Varietally correct aromas of white flowers, honey and lemon verbena set up a medium-weight palate with bright acidity and good overall balance. Spunky flavors of green grapes are offset by a slight banana-like sweetness. Consider this right for curries and other spicy foods.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Siegel 2019 Special Reserve Viognier (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crisp aromas of pure apricot and freshly squeezed lime meet with a chalky tightness on the nose of this bottling. There's an ample sizzle of acidity on the sip, where those apricot tones meet with flavors of lemon-glazed pastry and chalky wet earth.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Margerum 2019 Margerum Estate Vineyard Viognier (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Chiseled stone, light sandalwood, a pinch of chamomile and dried mango show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is loaded with yellow-peach and ripe cantaloupe flavors, yet those elements are deftly cut by a streak of crushed stone and tense acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Dusty Nabor 2019 The Florist Viognier (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Broad and bright aromas of plumeria and ripe apple kick off the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate is more tightly wound and focused on a lime-zest flavor, with a more rounded sense of bubblegum lingering in the background.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Section Wines 2019 Tierra Alta Vineyards Viognier (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From grapes grown in both the Dry Creek and Russian River valleys, this medium-bodied white opens in an effusive expanse of floral jasmine. Citrus, stone fruit and lemon peel follow along a sleek, high-toned palate that shows refinement and length.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hawley 2019 Viognier (Sonoma County)

Appellation: South Coast, South Coast, California, US
Description: Very mellow and subtle on the nose, this wine eventually shows aromas of light peach blossom, wet gravel and a slightly candied citrus tang. Brushes of peach, nectarine and pear show on the sip, which is fairly tight in texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Granite Lion 2019 Viognier (South Coast)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tightly focused aromas of lemon pith, dried honeysuckle, melon and turned earth show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is more ripe, with peach and generous melon flavors, held in check by a line of acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Martin Ranch 2017 Therese Vineyards Viognier (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Half the fruit for this wine comes from Lawrence Vineyard and the rest from Stoneridge. The aromas bring notes of ripe peach, flower and apricot. Full, viscous-feeling flavors follow, with some toasty notes on the finish. A quite warm finish caps it off. There are good things going on, but the ripeness and heat hold it back.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: The Royal Bull 2018 Royal Mistress Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sicilia, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas of toasted oak, butterscotch and ripe pineapple. The linear palate offers cedar, vanilla and grapefruit before a bitter almond finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Baglio di Pianetto 2018 Viafrancia Riserva Viognier (Sicilia)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fruit for this wine comes from Antoine Creek Vineyards in the Lake Chelan appellation. Aromas of canned peach lead to fruit flavors that paint around the edges. It has a pleasing tartness.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Succession 2019 Antoine Creek Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this bottling is very inviting, offering lemon-rind, peach-flesh, white-flower, lemongrass and chiseled stone aromas. The palate proves rather sweet, with ripe flavors of peach and pear.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Wilson Creek 2019 Chloe Vineyard Viognier (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Côtes du Lot, Southwest France, France
Description: This is a rich, silky textured wine. Wood aging has served to broaden it out, giving a light oxidation to go with the ripe apricots and perfumed white fruits. The wine is already delicious, but will be better from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lagrézette 2018 Le Pigeonnier White Vision Viognier (Côtes du Lot)

Appellation: Grignan-les-Adhémar, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Full bodied and dry, this impeccably balanced white offers crisp pineapple, blossom and tart tangerine flavors anchored by firm strikes of salty minerality. It's a refreshingly spry, silky expression of Viognier that finishes long on veins of vanilla and sweet spice. Best now–2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine de Montine 2018 Viognier (Grignan-les-Adhémar)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a slight haze in the glass on this bottling, which begins with aromas ranging from ripe peach to zingy lime, with hints of lemon and grapefruit zest. The palate is very citrus-driven and tense with tangy aspects, offering flavors of grapefruit skin as well as a rocky minerality.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Denner 2018 Viognier (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a compelling tightness to the nose of this bottling, which shows chiseled rock, yellow apple and a hint of ash. Lemon-peel, honeydew and apricot flavors are taut on the palate, which develops a peach tone by the finish but in a balanced way.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lion Ranch 2018 Viognier (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: San Antonio Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From the warm southern reaches of Monterey County, this bottling begins with aromas of peach, cashew cream and a pinch of sea salt. There are lean lines of peach and melon on the sip, where a penetrating acidity and rocky tension keep the wine moving across the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Odonata 2019 Marins Vineyard Viognier (San Antonio Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tight apple-blossom, candied jasmine and tart apple-slice aromas show on the nose of this bottling from the Mill Road and Four Lanterns vineyards. There's a pleasant ashy tone on the palate, where peach, melon and bubblegum flavors converge.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Eberle 2019 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are bright, with notes of flower, pear, peach and honeysuckle. Ripe stone fruit flavors follow, with the acidity of the vintage keeping it all in check.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Novelty Hill 2019 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are bright, with notes of flower, pear, peach and honeysuckle. Ripe stone fruit flavors follow, with the acidity of the vintage keeping it all in check.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Novelty Hill 2019 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Grignan-les-Adhémar, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Hints of crushed pineapple, honeysuckle and white peach abound in this fruity, primary expression of Viognier. It's juicy and voluptuous but maintains a crisp mineral balance. The finish is long and silken. Best enjoyed now–2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine du Serre des Vignes 2018 Loulys Viognier (Grignan-les-Adhémar)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This rich, soft and ripe-tasting wine folds peach, butter and almond flavors into a smooth texture and full body. It gives a nice sense of breadth and fullness for such a well-priced offering.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Cline 2019 Viognier (North Coast)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine is nicely concentrated and fruity, but also brings subtle butter and mineral flavors to the table. A creamy texture adds to its depth and complexity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Oak Grove 2019 Family Reserve Viognier (California)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A bit reductive in style, this bottling from vines planted in 1998 begins with wound-up aromas of lemon pith, tangerine peel and a hint of lanolin. There's a woolly note on the sip as well, where dried elderflower, tonic and walnut-extract flavors make for a unique experience.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Cooper-Garrod 2018 Randall Grahm Clone Viognier (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bright aromas of honeydew soda, cantaloupe balls, watermelon and peach show on the fruity nose of this bottling. The palate is rounded in peach and pear flavors that are cut with a splash of lime juice, finishing on a banana and bubblegum kick.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Le Vigne 2019 Il Fiore Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: A classic Viognier nose delivers apricots and blossoms. Rich stone fruit flavors meld with juicy acidity on the palate, alongside accents of rose and baking spice.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Maison de la Villette 2019 Viognier (Vin de France)

Appellation: River Junction, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Light floral aromas lead to fairly rich peach and Anjou pear flavors in this medium-bodied, smooth and fresh wine. The aromatics and just-ripe flavors make a good combination.                      Jim Gordon
Name: McManis 2019 Estate Grown Certified Sustainable Viognier (River Junction)

Appellation: Alentejano, Portugal
Description: With hints of the apricot flavors that often mark out Viognier, this is a rounded, creamy wine. It is young, and the bright acidity will soften over the next few months to give a wine that is both rich and balanced. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2019 Dona Maria Viognier (Alentejano)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: An amber tone in the color corroborates the mature, nutty, cidery flavors in this soft broad wine. It tastes off dry, generous and well aged.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Scotto Family Cellars 2019 Villa Antico Petillant Naturel Viognier (Lodi)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Yellow peach, apricot and satsuma aromas carry the nose. The palate brings flavors of orange and blossom that lead to a simplistic, pithy finish.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Maison Les Alexandrins 2018 Viognier (Vin de France)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Peach, pear, melon, Meyer lemon peel and wet rock aromas show on the engaging nose of this bottling, which is expertly restrained for an often overripe grape. The sizzling acidity of the palate leads into stony and mineral-driven flavors, with a citrus-slicked melon tone that never loses appeal.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Thacher 2018 Hastings Ranch Vineyard Viognier (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: This concrete-fermented Viognier is easily one of the best white wines to emerge from this region in recent years. Clean and crisp aromas of Asian pear flesh, lime zest, honeysuckle and chalk lead into a tight palate of wet gravel, ash, apple blossom and more pear flesh. The texture lingers long into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Doffo 2019 Concrete Fermented Viognier (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A golden yellow hue in the glass, this botrytized Viognier is the first instance of that noble rot happening in Byan Babcock's long career. Aromas of orange blossom extract and oozing honey lead into an extremely viscous palate of more honey drizzled on ripe melons and sprinkled with lemon zest, clove dust and butterscotch. Its unctuous sweetness almost makes the teeth hurt.                      Matt Kettmann
Designation: Once in a Lifetime Ultra Late Harvest
Name: Babcock 2018 Once in a Lifetime Ultra Late Harvest Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a bright and effusive white from the great site, steely in texture with vibrant characteristics of lychee, peach skin and pineapple. The nose is deeply defined in honeysuckle, winding its way to a complete, cohesive finish of neutral oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: McKahn 2019 Catie's Corner Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a blend of two lots, one fermented in stainless, one in new oak. It's a lovely, acid-driven wine, with pinpoint flavors of lemon, lime, gooseberry and green apple. The botanical highlights often found in Viognier are light, and the overall balance is excellent.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: King Estate 2018 Quail Run Vineyards Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Gramercy has charted a new course for this often overripe variety. Citrus, white-peach and mineral aromas are follow by exquisitely balanced pear and peach flavors. It has a pleasing, mouthwatering feel that is rare in Viognier in this state or elsewhere and that ups the interest.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Gramercy 2019 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Viognier is rare in the Willamette Valley, but examples such as Penner-Ash prove its viability. Here's another good one: a judicious blend of one-third concrete egg and two-thirds French oak barrel ferments. Gin-like botanical scents and flavors abound, and the palate is precise and punches down in clear, crisp detail. Drink this slightly chilled to firm up the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Left Coast 2017 Field of Dreams Viognier (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a bright sizzle of lime as well as creamier tones of pear flesh and honey on the nose of this bottling. A hint of toast kicks off the sip before brisk lemon and apple-flesh flavors arise, with fresh acidity and a tightly wound texture carrying toward the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Refugio Ranch 2018 Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Placer County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine blends fig and mineral and apricot flavors on a rich texture that's nicely lifted by tangy acidity. It has a smooth, broad mouthfeel and lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Carol Shelton 2018 Damiano Vineyard Viognier (Placer County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pear and peach aromas leap up out the glass, along with notes of flower, herb and melon. There's a sleekness and brightness to the white-peach flavors that ups the interest for this often over-weighted and oily variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Time & Direction 2019 Fretboard Corfu Crossing Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light aromas of ripe peach, orange and honeysuckle kick off this well-honed Viognier. There is tactile energy and grippy texture to the sip, where broad flavors of orange cream, jasmine and more peach ride bright acidity into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: San Simeon 2019 Stefano Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: Sizzling acidity lies beneath oily apricot and green apple in this earthy, viscous and brightly high-toned white wine.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2019 Viognier (Oak Knoll District)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are bright, with notes of pear, flower and peach. Medium-plus bodied, quite pure-seeming melon and stone-fruit flavors follow. It brings a lot of appeal and spot-on balance.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Forgeron 2019 Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Petaluma Gap-Marin County, North Coast, California, US
Description: Big flavors and a full rich texture make this wine very robust, mouthfilling and delicious. Luckily it has good acidity to nicely balance the ripe apricot and orange-blossom notes.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Kendric 2019 Proprietor Grown Viognier (Petaluma Gap-Marin County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Made 100% varietal, the grapes stainless-steel fermented and aged, this wine is earthy in jasmine and geranium, the texture viscous and thick. Pineapple and pear flavors round out the experience.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Ampelos 2019 Phi Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from Canyon Vineyard Ranch, aromas of flower, Creamsicle and barrel spice are followed by full-bodied ripe apricot flavors, with plentiful barrel accents. A warm toasty finish follows. It shows the variety's riper side, with the oak playing a prominent role.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Waterbrook 2018 Icon Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Broad aromas of melon, peach, baked apple and tropical guava flesh show on the nose of this bottling. There is a flash of sizzling acidity to the sip, before the ripe pear and peach flavors return.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Cass 2019 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas pop, with notes of cantaloupe, canned peach, fresh flower and freshly peeled orange rind. The palate is sleek in style, with plenty of floral flavors and citrus flavors along with tart acidity. It's an odd mixture of overripe and underripe fruit.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: TruthTeller 2019 Frolic Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A sharp and strongly herbal wine, this amplifies Viognier's natural bent toward botanical flavors, with bitter citrus rind. Grapefruit pith and lime skins come through, along with other citrus notes, but what's absent is any off-setting fruit sweetness.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Pebblestone 2018 Ellis Vineyards Block 8 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Produced from some of the oldest Viognier vines in Washington, the aromas of paint and orange rind seem to show some oxygen exposure. The palate falls flat, revealing some alcohol.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Stottle 2018 Elerding Vineyard Viognier (Washington)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine offers subtle chalk, fig and peach flavors wrapped in buttery overtones and it finishes with a chalky bitterness.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Frey 2018 Organic Viognier (California)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very bright and crisp in the glass, this bottling from a historic vineyard shows intense peach and white-flower aromas along with a touch of lime balm. There is great grip to the sip, where fresh and vibrant flavors of white peach and pineapple are wrapped in a chalky texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: D'Alfonso-Curran 2018 Sanford & Benedict Viognier (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fruit for this wine comes from an up-and-coming site on the Royal Slope. The aromas pop, with notes of honeysuckle, peach and wet slate. Full-bodied but still fresh, rounded fruit flavors follow—like biting into a ripe peach. It brings a sense of texture and intensity that is captivating and will do well with some time in the cellar. Best after 2021.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Time & Direction 2018 Fretboard Corfu Crossing Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming out of the winery's estate vineyard in the Rocks District and fermented in concrete egg, the wine boasts generous aromas of ripe peach, honeysuckle, melon rind and mineral, followed by full-bodied, nectarous, textured stone fruit flavors. It's like drinking a fresh peach in a glass of rocks.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Saviah 2018 Saviah Estate Vineyard Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is an exotic, floral and seamlessly bright white, opulently layered in apple, lemon and melon fruitiness. Bold and full bodied, it veers into a weight of viscosity but never feels heavy on the palate, awash in crisp acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Joseph Swan Vineyards 2017 Catie's Corner Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bright pear and fresh key lime aromas meet with a broad streak of savory smoke on the nose of this bottling. There's a great sizzle to the sip, where a chalky texture carries lemon, light nectarine and sea salt flavors into a waxy finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Larner 2018 Viognier (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Yellow pear, white peach, honeysuckle and guava peel converge on the nose of this bottling from Doug Margerum's relatively new estate property. There is a grapefruit-peel tension to the palate, where acid zings through the white-fleshed fruit flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Margerum 2018 Margerum Estate Vineyard Viognier (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Atlas Peak, Napa, California, US
Description: A partnership between winemakers Yves Gangloff and Jeff Cohn, this hearty white from the famous site opens in floral aromatics of jasmine and apple blossom. From there it leads to stone and green apple on the palate, which is opulent and oak-driven with lasting grip and power.                      Virginie Boone
Designation: Two Guys Two Barrels Stagecoach Vineyard
Name: Jeff Cohn 2018 Two Guys Two Barrels Stagecoach Vineyard Viognier (Atlas Peak)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Three-quarters was fermented in concrete egg, the rest in a new puncheon, and the blend includes 23% Marsanne. Bright and spicy, the fruit focuses on peach and apricot. There's a texture and subflavor of wet cement and a firm frame of lemon curd.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Naumes 2017 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Priorat, Catalonia, Spain
Description: Aromatically speaking, this Viognier smells less floral and soapy than many, with minerally notes of crushed vitamin taking the lead. A fleshy palate with white-fruit tannins shows some grip, while this tastes bready and melony. A smooth finish, with lees notes concludes this round-bodied, high-quality Priorat white.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Vall Llach 2016 Aigua De Llum Viognier (Priorat)

Appellation: Marlborough, New Zealand
Description: This deep gold-hued Viognier wears the distinctive Hans Herzog (who grows 26 different varieties!) varsity sweater: rich, unctuous and highly terroir-driven. For now, though, this wine wears the oak on its sleeve. The toasty, buttery aromas are accompanied by layers of flavor: baked pear, pineapple rind, clove, minerals and lees. Full-bodied, earthy, mineral flavors are at the fore on the palate, and the alcohol shows. Underneath lurks the tangy fruit. This could never be accused of dullness, but there are more harmonious wines in the Hans stable.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Hans Family Estate 2017 Viognier (Marlborough)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Nectarine, red-apple and lemon-rind aromas are shy but just expressive enough to draw in the nose on this estate bottling from a longtime Rhône leader. The palate is tense and fresh, with flavors of apple, chalk and a hint of underripe pineapple.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Zaca Mesa 2017 Estate Vineyard Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Marlborough, New Zealand
Description: This deep gold-hued Viognier wears the distinctive Hans Herzog (who grows 26 different varieties!) varsity sweater: rich, unctuous and highly terroir-driven. For now, though, this wine wears the oak on its sleeve. The toasty, buttery aromas are accompanied by layers of flavor: baked pear, pineapple rind, clove, minerals and lees. Full-bodied, earthy, mineral flavors are at the fore on the palate, and the alcohol shows. Underneath lurks the tangy fruit. This could never be accused of dullness, but there are more harmonious wines in the Hans stable.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Hans Family Estate 2017 Viognier (Marlborough)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A toasty oak aroma wraps up the poached pear and lemon-peel tones on the nose of this bottling. Rich but pleasant flavors of peach, brioche, seared lemon and daffodil round out the sip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Glunz 2018 White Hawk Vineyard Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Toasty aromas of baked apple meet with elderflower and a hint of tonic water on the inviting nose of this bottling. The palate is smooth but a bit flat, carrying flavors of apple pie and cinnamon.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Vigo 2018 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Broad aromas of candied mango meet with cold steel firmness on the nose of this bottling from Duvarita Vineyard, located west of the Sta. Rita Hills. The palate is taut and slightly vinous, offering flavors of peach and mango.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: J. Dirt 2018 Duvarita Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a slightly reductive start to the nose of this bottling, but it quickly opens toward lemon peel and singed citrus on the nose. More lemon spray hits the palate, where baked apple and sea-salt flavors arise.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Zinke 2016 White Hawk Vineyard Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The mouthfeel falls flat, and the wine, which pushes toward 16% alcohol, finishes bitter and hot. There's a suggestion of oak as well, though no barrel aging is indicated.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Schmidt 2018 Reserve Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine is big and broad from the first whiff of salted, roasted almonds to ripe fig flavors and an almost custard-like finish. It's not so much ripe fruitiness but rich baking spices and buttered popcorn that lead the charge.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Cedarville 2018 Estate Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This indulgent, mature wine is distinctive and complex. It shows a deep gold color, rich butter and marzipan aromas and a medium to full body, while bracing acidity and a bone-dry character keep it slightly restrained and well-balanced.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sol Rouge 2017 Viognier (Lake County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Deliciously fruity and rich, this full-bodied wine also refreshes the palate with good acidity as bright apricot and peach flavors mingle with richer hints of vanilla and almond. Blended with 5% each of Marsanne and Roussanne, it is very tasty and well balanced.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Starfield 2018 Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This spicy showcase sports varied botanical aromas and flavor highlights, and the fruit seems anchored in lemon rind—not a criticism, but a firm stylistic approach that may help determine the optimal food matches. There are also suggestions of jicama and white melon, and the length and crisp definition provide a good finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Dobbes Family Estate 2019 Sundown Vineyard Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from perhaps the state's premier Viognier site, aromas of melon rind, citrus, flower, peach and pear lead to sleek, lighter styled stone fruit flavors that still bring a sense of intensity. The acid balance is impressive for the variety. It carries on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Prospice 2019 Gamache Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Aromas of spiced apple and orange blossom give way to rich pear and banana flavors in this full-bodied, broad-textured wine. It is big and mouthcoating, with a lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lava Cap 2018 Reserve Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Grand Valley, Colorado, US
Description: On the nose, aromas of lemons, grass clippings and lime peels are dipped in Calamansi juice. Juicy on the palate and full of vibrant energy, bright, ripe and sunny tones of apple and Mandarin orange are highlighted by a delicate bouquet of white flowers. The acidity is charming and well integrated. A dry finish lingers long and juicy, pushing flavors of white peach and clementine.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Aspen Peak 2019 Viognier (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Grand Valley, Colorado, US
Description: The nose is packed with tones of just-picked lime, freshly cut grass and a dusting of pollen. Strong citrus plows through on the palate in flavors of fresh lemon and ripe Key lime, threatening to turn sour. It's light in texture, with crashing waves of acidity and a vibrant lime flavor that dominates the dry finish.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Carboy 2018 Viognier (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Colorado, Colorado, US
Description: A floral nose offers highlights of white lily, fresh pear and orange oil. Apricot and peach flavors are joined by Satsuma orange on the thick syrup-textured palate. A lazy line of acidity is present but lacks some vibrancy. Tones of candied lemon, butter cookie and a hint of sweet cinnamon introduce the finish, with a final dollop of lemon pith.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Sutcliffe 2018 Viognier (Colorado)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied, stainless-steel fermented wine combines crispness and ripeness in good proportions as good acidity balances rich peach, orange-blossom and almond flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Paskett 2018 Ripken Vineyard Viognier (Lodi)

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Vibrant aromas of ripe peach, Jolly Rancher and pear are followed by plentiful stone fruit flavors backed by tart acidity. The fruit seems a bit overripe but the acidity holds it together.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Tunnel Hill 2018 Estate Bottled Viognier (Lake Chelan)

Appellation: Colorado, Colorado, US
Description: The blossomy and grassy nose is accented by apple tones. The palate echoes the nose, adding lemon pith to the grassy profile. The acidity is tart and biting, lightly souring the palate. However, a juicy lemon note muscles through to mark the finish before gently fading.                      Fiona Adams
Name: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey 2018 Viognier (Colorado)
Winery: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Vanilla aromas are out front, followed by peach, creamsicle and flower, with the palate showing more of the same. The oak plays far too prominent of a role, getting in the way of the fruit.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Milbrandt 2018 The Estates Clifton Hill Vineyard Viognier (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Wafting of rose petals and peach marmalade, this is the lustiest, most flamboyant white wine imaginable. It's unabashedly hedonistic, classically Condrieu, and yet invitingly fresh and balanced. It's a bottling that's ready now but sure to please beyond 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: François Villard 2017 Le Grand Vallon  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Pronounced aromas of orange blossom and tangerine peel are framed by delicate honey, smoke and sweet spice in this textbook Condrieu. It's unctuous on the palate and intensely concentrated with fresh grapefruit and orange flavors yet maintains freshness throughout. The finish is lusciously honeyed and long. It would be delightful now or in a decade.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: François Villard 2017 Les Terrasses du Palat  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: More floral and freshly fruited than the producer's Terrasses bottling, this sunny Viognier wafts of orchard peaches, rose petals and honeysuckle. It's a plush, sensual sip held upright by a crush of minerality and lingering tea tannins. Ready to drink now, it will hold through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: François Villard 2017 Les Contours de Deponcins Viognier (Vin de France)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This was a very fine vintage for the Applegate Valley, as this strikingly rich reserve demonstrates. Viognier is always a strong suit at Cowhorn, here showing lush aromas of lemon furniture polish and orange liqueur, then punching up ripe fruit flavors with a particular emphasis on candied apricot. There's a suggestion of crème caramel also, and the richness continues through an extended finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Cowhorn 2018 Reserve Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Exuberant aromas of honeysuckle, white peach and vanilla introduce this big, rich Viognier. It's opulent and creamy, filling the palate with waves of orange cream, rose petal and marmalade, but keenly balanced by a rim of tea tannins on the finish. Decadent and irresistible young it's structured enough to improve through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Christophe Pichon 2017  Condrieu

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Intense aromas of rose-petal jam, white peach and even raspberry perfume this voluptuous, powerful Viognier. Honey and tangerine flavors are unctuous and voluminous on the palate but a lift of freshness shows on the midpalate. This substantial wine is delicious already but likely to hold well through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine François Merlin 2017 Jean Raude  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Notes of white blossom and fresh apricot perfume this opulent but fresh-fruited Condrieu. Asian pear and white peach flavors are juicy but crisp, accented by delicate hings of smoke and hazelnut. Enjoy this bright, youthful Viognier now through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Vignobles Verzier 2017 Authentic  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Lavish layers of vanilla, cinnamon and honeysuckle accent this ripe, gycerol sip. Flavors of yellow apple and white grapefruit are plush and mouthfilling but balanced by a spry mineral lift and a hint of bitters on the finish. Hedonistic and ready to drink, it should serve well through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Gabriel Meffre 2017 Laurus  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Indulgent in body and texture, this full-throttled Viognier highlights fleshy tones of white peach and apricot preserves. It's a musky, perfumed wine that wafts of dried orange peel, sweet spice and rose petals. The finish undulates on the palate, framed by fine, taut tea tannins. Best enjoyed now–2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine du Chêne 2017 Volan  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Brisker and brighter in fruit than the producer's more opulent Jean Raude, this perfumed Viognier offers crisp but concentrated white peach and tangerine flavors dusted by sprays of orange blossom. It's silk textured and fleshy but fresh enough to enjoy as an aperitif. Best enjoyed now–2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine François Merlin 2017 Les Terroirs  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: An invigorating mineral edge mingles with headier marmalade, rose petal and peach in this plump white wine. It's soft and languid in mouthfeel but stone fruit and citrus flavors are pristine and penetrating. Blossomy and expressive in its youth, it's a delight already and should drink well through 2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: André François 2017 La Maladière  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Veritably spry in the typically unctuous world of Condrieu, this medium-bodied Viognier offers crisp, cutting Asian pear and tangerine flavors edged by invigorating mineral freshness. Spicy whiffs of vanilla, smoke and orange cream keep it true to style. This juicy, exuberantly youthful sip is best enjoyed now through 2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Vallet 2017 Rouelle-Midi  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Crisp white grapefruit and tangerine flavors lend an unusually spry charater to this full-bodied but pristine Condrieu. Accented by whispers of vanilla and sweet spice, it's an alluring, expansive wine but elegant and restrained, not hulking. The finish is marked by a pleasant bite of tea tannins. Best now–2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: M. Chapoutier 2017 Invitare  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: While opulent and ample in mouthfeel, this juicy Viognier bursts with fresh white grapefruit and pristine pear flavors. It's joyfully fruity and forward but balanced by earthen nuances of cut stone and smoke too. Ready to enjoy now it should improve through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Delas Frères 2017 Galopine  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Given time in both neutral French oak and stainless-steel barrels, this bold, robust white is fruity, floral and fresh in peach and cream. With good underlying acidity, it holds its weight well, showing length and breadth across a palate accented in nutmeg and clove.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Clif Family 2018 Viognier (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Unusually mineral in style, this full-bodied, juicy Viognier showcases fresh pear and apple flavors laytered with cut stone and salt. True to the variety still, it's plush in texture and finishes on a lingering honey tone. Ready to drink now, it should hold through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Chambeyron 2017 Vernon  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Although this wine is initially more earthen than fruity on the nose, time and aeration bring out pure, sunny flavors of apricot and yellow peach. It's a juicy, remarkably quaffable Viognier balanced by fresh tangerine acidity and fine, lingering tea tannins. Enjoy this wine now through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ferraton Père et Fils 2017 Les Mandouls  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Bold yellow apple and pear on the nose of this wine are accented by hints of sweet spice, earth and stone. It's a rounded, silky wine edged by honey and marmalade but fresh on its feet too. This vibrant Condrieu is approachable now.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Maison Denuzière 2017 J. Denuzière  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Lighter bodied and brisk in concentration compared to more robust examples of Condrieu, this mouthwatering sip offers crisp yellow plum and peach flavors. It's an immediately approachable wine but finessed, finishing on hints of smoke, vanilla and cashew. Drink now–2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Boissonnet 2017  Condrieu

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: In this wine, heady top notes of vanilla, brioche and smoke seep into concentrated yellow apple and grapefruit. Full bodied and just a touch warming, it's an open, generous wine freshened by a mineral lift on the finish. Ready now, it should hold well through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Louis Bernard 2017  Condrieu

Appellation: Eden Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: The nose of this wine is fruity but delicately so, wafting stone and orchard fruit, citrus blossom, honeysuckle and fresh ginger. The palate is compact, set for aging into a more honeyed creature over the next eight to 10 years, its slippery texture sliced by acidity. Drink now–2030.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Yalumba 2017 The Virgilius Viognier (Eden Valley)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Crushed-mineral tones persist in this ripe and voluminous but crisply concentrated Condrieu. Fresh grapefruit and pear flavors are lip smacking and juicy on the palate, finishing on barely-there wisps of smoke, vanilla and nut. Drink now through 2023 to maximize its ebullient fruit profile.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Martin Clerc 2017 Côte Bellay  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Alentejano, Portugal
Description: The wood fermentation shows lightly in this ripely fruity wine. Apricot and tropical fruits are dominant, giving richness and warmth to contrast with the fresher acidity. Drink this fruity, elegant wine from late 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2017 Amantis Reserva Viognier (Alentejano)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This barrel-fermented, reserve-level wine is smooth and open, with ample flavors of apple, butter cookie and vanilla. Aged almost a full year sur lie, it reflects the cool vintage with well-defined phenolic herbal flavors. There's a touch of toast in the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: 2Hawk 2017 Darow Series Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Eden Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: Samuel's Collection is the newest range in Yalumba's vast stable of wines, and thus far it has proven itself with a gaggle of solid, characterful and affordable wines. The Viognier doesn't disappoint. A heady nose of lemon-lime, orange peel, stone fruit, honey and flowers, with an underlying mineral note that adds a little complexity. The mouthfeel is slippery with lifted acidity, bright, concentrated fruit and a slight spiciness. The most complete wine in this brand's Viognier range, ready to drink now.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Yalumba 2017 Samuel's Collection Viognier (Eden Valley)

Appellation: Cévennes, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Beguiling aromas of summer peach and fresh tangerine introduce this explosively peachy, fruity Viognier. It's supple and soft on the palate but anchored by a touch of bitters on the finish. The wine is a perfect pick for summer picnics or a year-round aperitif.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: S. Delafont 2017 Viognier (Cévennes)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Lovely aromas set up a highly perfumed style of Viognier. From nose to mouth, those floral highlights, with ample botanicals in the mix, put a spicy and focused character front and center here. Citrus zest more than citrus fruit holds the center palate, and those botanical highlights turn slightly bitter in the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: J. Scott Cellars 2018 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Maremma Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made with Viognier fermented and aged in barrique, this has subtle aromas evoking mature yellow stone fruit, vineyard dust a whiff of honeysuckle. The palate offers dried apricot and star anise while a saline note marks the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Pinciana 2017 Viognier (Maremma Toscana)

Appellation: South Australia, South Australia, Australia
Description: Yalumba has been championing Viognier Down Under for many years. The entry-level version offers all the sun-kissed fruity aromas typical to the variety, with an affordable price tag attached. Pale gold, the wine has a nose that is a heady mix of baked figs, candied peach, honey and musk. The palate is bright and fresh but slippery textured, with a slight spiciness at the finish.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Yalumba 2019 The Y Series Viognier (South Australia)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Prominent and fruit-forward aromas of peach blossom and ripe tangerines lead the way on the nose of this bottling. The ripe peach and dried apple flavors of the palate are deftly cut down by sizzling acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Stasis 2018 Murmur Vineyard Viognier (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tightly woven aromas of lemon peels, grapefruit rinds, yellow apple and wet stone show on the nose of this bottling. There is a great grip to the sip, then the tightness unwinds to reveal warmer tones of ripe peach and roasted pineapple, finishing on an apple-peel tang.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Sculpterra 2018 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Bright aromas of nectarine, canned peach, flower and spice lead to dry, slightly leaner styled stone fruit flavors. It finishes a bit short on an otherwise enjoyable wine.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Simpatico 2018 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Knights Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Pungent and floral, this wine is intensely flavored and full bodied, with a depth of ripe apricot, nectarine and fleshy texture. The robust nature includes noticeable oak and creaminess.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Lawer 2018 Betsy's Vineyard Viognier (Knights Valley)

Appellation: Mount Veeder, Napa, California, US
Description: This vineyard-designate was fermented and aged in one-third stainless-steel and two-thirds used French oak, providing an intensely steely palate of dried apricot, honey and lemon cream.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Bougetz 2018 Belle Reve Yates Family Vineyard Viognier (Mount Veeder)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine shows some reduction out of the gate. Beneath that are aromas of peach and wilted flower. Light, off-dry stone fruit flavors follow.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Swiftwater 2018 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: South Australia, South Australia, Australia
Description: This white offers delicate aromas of honeyed nut, orange, peach and flowers. Creamy textured in the mouth, it has a short finish. It lacks the upfront charm of the producer's other Viognier bottlings.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Yalumba 2018 Made With Organic Grapes Viognier (South Australia)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas pop, with notes of flower, musk, evergreen and white grapefruit zest. Off-dry drinking, creamy-feeling flavors follow, with vanilla and smoky barrel notes on the finish. It's an odd mix.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Maryhill 2018 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: While earthen and smoky initially, this bold Viognier reveals zesty tangerine and white-floral perfume with time and aeration. It's a hefty wine that collapses in waves of peach and apricot on the palate. This classic representation of Condrieu should hold well through 2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Delas Frères 2017 La Galopine  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Notes of apricot and white blossom build from nose to palate in this voluptuous Viognier. Concentrated peach and orange-cream flavors undulate on the palate, rimmed by heady vanilla and anise. This is a bold, flashy sip, anchored by a pleasant bite of bitters on the finish.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Château de Saint-Cosme 2017  Condrieu

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Beautiful orange-blossom and honeysuckle aromas are joined by rich, ripe peach and mango flavors in this effusive, delicious wine. The mouthfeel is rich and creamy, but nicely balanced by a lime-zest impression of acidity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: E16 2018 Baby Rattlesnake Vineyard Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Toasty aromas of oak and smoke give a savory framing to the yellow-peach core on this bottling. The smoke shows on the sip as well, where white-peach and dried pineapple flavors also arise.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Wildeye 2018 Viognier (Central Coast)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: The aroma of this full-bodied wine is absolutely packed with vanilla, dried figs and baking spices, while the flavors and body come up slightly leaner, but still mouthfilling. It's a big white wine, flavorful and not blatantly fruity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Tanner 2018 Estate Grown Viognier (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling, which includes 15% Roussanne, is very sharp and crisp on the nose, offering orange-rind, white-peach and melon aromas. It's also penetrating on the sip with citrusy edges that cut into the rounded peach, butter and oak flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: McClain Cellars 2017 Open Arms Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A mature, nutty, earthy quality pervades this unusual but very tasty and rich wine. It has the sweetness and aged complexity of a late harvest dessert wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Aloria 2018 Estate Viognier (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
