Description: Noteworthy for a deep golden color and very buttery flavors, this full-bodied wine doesn't hold back. Butterscotch, marzipan and toasted nuts coat the palate while an almost thick texture gives a syrupy effect.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Ironstone 2017 Estate Grown Reserve Viognier (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Petrol and popcorn notes are part of an oily, briny nose with tropical hints. A fleshy palate is full in volume and oily in feel, backed by grapefruit and tropical flavors. Lastly, controlled bitter notes rise up on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Siegel 2018 Special Reserve Viognier (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Progreso, Uruguay
Description: Lemon peel aromas are tight and limited, while this Viognier is low in alcohol and thus lean in body. Salty, tangy lemon flavors lead to a healthy finish. Overall, this exhibits good balance although it lacks the typical oily and floral character Viognier is known for.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Progreso 2019 Overground Viognier (Progreso)

Appellation: Maldonado, Uruguay
Description: Grassy white fruit aromas come with a chemical note, while this is plump and pulpy in feel. Initial melony flavors turn bready and lightly oxidized before finishing with plump weightiness.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Alto de la Ballena 2018 Viognier (Maldonado)

Appellation: Chile, Chile
Description: Flat, resiny aromas suggest pine and banana pudding. This Viognier carries itself in a heavy and syrupy way, with ripe, resiny pineapple flavors that finish short and abrupt. This is just past its peak in terms of freshness.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Cono Sur 2018 Bicicleta Reserva Viognier (Chile)

Appellation: Curicó Valley, Chile
Description: This unfiltered natural-style Viognier smells pulpy and like apple juice. The palate is flat due to low acidity, while applesauce and dried white fruit flavors finish with bitter notes.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Echeverria 2019 ¡No es Pituko! Natural Wine Viognier (Curicó Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas bring plenty of appeal, with notes of honeysuckle, flower, whole pear, crushed rock and peach, bringing a sense of nuance. The palate is full but crisp in feel, showing a lovely sense of tension and depth, along with lively acidity. Structure, balance, depth, intensity, dexterity.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Mark Ryan 2018 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Viognier is a strong suit at Cowhorn. This deftly mixes juicy citrus and ripe peach fruit, amped up on tart acidity. The texture and underlying minerality contribute further complexity, with terrific tension and balance through the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Cowhorn 2018 Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean lines of Meyer lemon, mango and ripe melon are generous without being overbearing on the well-balanced nose of this bottling by winemaker Joey Tensley for pop star Fergie. There are ripe flashes of peach on the palate yet a citrus freshness and stony grip are unrelentingly tense, leading to an ashy finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Ferguson Crest 2018 Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Viognier can go in many different directions, from bitter and botanical to fruity and syrupy, but rarely is it perfectly on point, as it is here. Ripe lemon and tangerine, along with highlights of grapefruit and nectarine, combine in a refreshing, mouthfilling wine with a creamy minerality adding texture throughout. Fermented in neutral French oak, it's a versatile and delicious wine perfectly suited to the site.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Reustle 2018 Estate Selection Viognier (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Mt. Harlan, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of toast, lemon preserves, orange marmalade and light almond paste show on the nose of this bottling, which is a very compelling substitute for Chardonnay. There is a toasty core to the sip, where seared melon and orange-peel flavors meet with sea salt and brioche.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Calera 2017 Viognier (Mt. Harlan)

Appellation: Idaho, US
Description: Viognier is the variety that led winemaker Melanie Krause to move back to Idaho to make wine, and this wine shows the promise. The aromas draw you into the glass with notes of flower, herb, peach and pear. Medium-bodied, well-balanced flavors follow. It shows a lovely sense of acidity for the variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Cinder 2018 Dry Viognier

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Powerfully ripe fruit flavors mix both citrus and tropical elements. In the opening aromatics you'll note some floral highlights as well. As the wine rolls through the full-bodied palate, the Viognier shows some bite as it finishes. This may benefit from another year or two of bottle age.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Season 2017 Viognier (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All of the fruit for this wine comes from Gamache Vineyard. The aromas offer notes of Jolly Rancher, flower and honey-drizzled peach, showing the intensity of a dessert wine. The palate is rich in flavor, showing a ripe style, tapering toward the warm finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Eternal 2018 Eternal Sunshine Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This white has inviting floral aromatics of jasmine and white flower, the grapes from the great site in the heart of the appellation. Ripe apricot, peach and lemon give the wine a full-bodied intensity and viscosity that is weighty and dense.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Aver Family Vineyards 2018 Benevolent Catie's Corner Vineyard Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles Highlands District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very ripe aromas of bubblegum, coconut, tropical soda and Sunny Delight make for a loud nose on this bottling. It does tighten considerably on the sip, wrapping the mango and papaya flavors in a wet stone edge.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Crū 2018 French Camp Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles Highlands District)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A soft and rather light version of this varietal, it's easy-drinking, smooth and creamy in the mouth. Flavors suggest lemon meringue and a light hint of pie crust. Drink up over the next year or two.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Simple Machine 2018 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sleek, stony and bright in lemon and green apple, this wine has a nutty character to the midpalate and a touch of viscosity that settles in the glass. Barrel-fermented, the finish shows an intensity of body and richness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: ZO Wines 2018 BDV Viognier (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a thick, rich and creamy white, viscous in vanilla cookie, peach and jasmine. Supportive underlying acidity helps it reach some balance between its weight of integrated oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Kunde 2018 Estate Grown Viognier (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This warm and spiced wine offers tempting apricot and almond aromas, rich marzipan and apricot flavors and a very smooth, luxurious texture. It reveals layered, subtle oak spices and intense fruit and mineral components.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Terre Rouge 2017 Viognier (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very fresh and tropical aromas of mango and tuberose are very refreshing and inviting on the nose of this Viognier-based dessert bottling. It's thick and sweet on the palate yet still fresh and lively with pineapple syrup, jasmine and more mango. Pleasantly dynamic for dessert.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Alta Colina 2018 Vin de Paille Viognier (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Placer County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine lets the pure character of the grape show through in the aromas of honeysuckle and lime, the tangy citrus and floral flavors, and adds a buttery touch to the finish. It's medium to full-bodied, and shows good crisp acidity in addition to a bit of mouthfilling roundness.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Le Casque 2018 Damiano Vineyard Viognier (Placer County)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Exotic and tropical aromas of citrus and melon meet with dried peach and mango on the nose of this bottling. It lands smoothly on the palate with a creamy texture, carrying almond, orange-rind and honeydew flavors as well as a bit of savory salinity.                      Matt Kettmann
Designation: C'est La Vie Wine Chateau Reserve
Name: Europa Village 2017 C'est La Vie Wine Chateau Reserve Viognier (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light peach, sea salt, cold steel and wet river-stone aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is solid tension to the sip, where Meyer lemon and stone-fruit flavors arise with a pleasant prominence.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hoyt Family Vineyards 2018 Viognier (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Ripe fruit flavors and a rich texture come together nicely in this full-bodied wine. Coconut-milk, honeydew melon and lemon-zest elements contribute to excellent flavor concentration, while a luxurious texture and lingering finish make the wine memorable.                      Jim Gordon
Name: The White Knight 2018 Viognier (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Saddle Rock-Malibu, South Coast, California, US
Description: Prominent honeysuckle aromas meet with earthy aromas of lanolin and wet soil on the nose of this bottling. Dried citrus and a hint of nectarine show on the palate, where a kiss of oak is also apparent.                      Matt Kettmann
Designation: Cielo Vineyards Malibu Estate Three Sixty-Five
Name: Cielo 2017 Cielo Vineyards Malibu Estate Three Sixty-Five Viognier (Saddle Rock-Malibu)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Strong aromas of white peach and grilled pineapple meet with sweet oak and smoke on the nose of this bottling. It is very ripe on the palate, with more smoke and dense fruit flavors, ranging from more seared pineapple to savory sea salt. It would work well with roasted poultry and gravy.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Summerwood 2018 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are vibrant, redolent with notes of pear, honeysuckle and melon. The flavors can't quite deliver on all of this promise, sleek and light, with Mandarin orange notes on the warm finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Structure 2018 Oculus Viognier (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light in the glass, this is an immensely tropical style of Viognier, showing tuberose, jasmine, plumeria and coconut-oil aromas. There is a great sizzle of acidity and texture to the sip, which keeps those same tropical touches in check.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Vina Robles 2018 Huerhuero Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Broad aromas of pear flesh and cut by Key lime pith on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard named after the family's patriarch, who recently passed away. The pleasant palate combines jasmine, honeysuckle and ripe peach flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: San Simeon 2018 Stefano Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Aromas of toast, vanilla, preserved peach and caramel are heady here, lending flair to orange cream and honey on the palate. It's rich and unctuous, silky in texture, but fringed by pleasing bitters. A beauty already, it should evolve positively through 2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Jean-Luc Colombo 2017 Amour de Dieu  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Golden honey in color, this is a thick, rich and balanced dessert wine made from 100% Viognier allowed to hang long into the season to develop botrytis. Textured, it tastes of apricot and brioche, with a complex structure.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Anaba 2018 Landa Vineyard Late Harvest Viognier (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Whiffs of sun-kissed grain or hay are restrained on the nose, but the palate of this voluminous Viognier bursts of peach, honeysuckle and apricot. It's lavish and textured, with a long, warming finish marked by layers of saffron and candle wax.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: E. Guigal 2017  Condrieu

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Loads of fresh lemons are delivered on a bed of white flowers to make up the aroma. Ripe lemon and calamansi take on a lightly pithy edge on the palate, which is loaded with juicy acidity and crushed minerals. White pepper tones slink in on the long juicy finish.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Barboursville Vineyards 2017 Reserve Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Peach and melon aromas are prominent but properly reserved on the nose of this bottling, which also offers hints of apple butter. There is a pleasant plushness to the palate, where dried nectarine and ash flavors arise, with a light caramel tone on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Martin Ranch 2016 Therese Vineyards Viognier (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Creamy butterscotch and honey notes are countered by fresh tangerines in this luscious, lingering Viognier. It's an opulent, mouthfilling wine lifted by a tang of minerality on the finish. It drinks best now until 2021.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine du Chêne 2017  Condrieu

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This is a vibrantly peachy, perfumed Viognier with a juicy, full-bodied palate. It's exuberant and forward but elegantly structured too, edged by brisk tones of crushed stone, lime and lemon. Enjoy this weighty, satisfying sip now to 2022.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Château du Trignon 2018 Viognier (Côtes du Rhône)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: A deep orange-tinged gold color in the glass, this Viognier offers orange, kumquat, Satsuma orange and oolong tea with a hint of sweet spice on a come-hither nose. The palate offers much of the same in flavors of orange, oolong, marigold and pear with warm spice, gently gripping tea tannin and tangy acidity.                      Fiona Adams
Name: King Family 2017 Small Batch Series Viognier (Monticello)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Attractive floral aromas and melon-like flavors make this medium-bodied wine a crowd-pleaser. It shows decent concentration, good balance and a fairly lively texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bella Grace 2018 Viognier (Amador County)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Citrus and Honeycrisp apple aromas are backed by yellow blossoms. Tart green apples are bright and fresh on the palate, propped up by sunny and charming acidity. The finish lingers on lemon juice and Asian pear.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Paradise Springs 2017 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: Apple, Bartlett pear and blossom aromas introduce a palate of navel orange, Golden Delicious apple and Meyer lemon. The pithy, tugging finish is laced with lemon-lime acidity.                      Fiona Adams
Name: White Hall 2017 Viognier (Monticello)

Appellation: River Junction, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This light-bodied wine offers soft, pleasant tones of flowers and honeydew. It is straightforward yet well balanced.                      Jim Gordon
Name: McManis 2018 Estate Grown Certified Sustainable Viognier (River Junction)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: A very green nose is almost mushroomy, combining wildflowers and wet grass. The palate is far riper in tones of Mandarin orange and peach with tangy and juicy acidity. The dry, lemony finish brings back the grassiness of the nose.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Rappahannock Cellars 2017 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This is a medium-weight wine, with moderately fruity aromas and flavors and a soft light texture. It's something pleasant and undemanding to sip.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Cline 2018 Viognier (North Coast)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: Fresh, wafting lemon and grapefruit aromas are touched with blossoms on a bright and fresh nose. The slippery palate is loaded with ripe citrus and fresh hay. A pithy bitterness enters the finish, tugging things short.                      Fiona Adams
Name: King Family 2017 Viognier (Monticello)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: A lean core of crisp fruit is wrapped in a buttery layer that weighs it down. The wine is light bodied and spare on the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Oak Grove 2018 Family Reserve Viognier (California)

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Assertive and earthy, this full-bodied wine gives off a petrol aroma, offers strong menthol and fruit flavors and has vivid acidity for a tangy mouthfeel.                      Jim Gordon
Name: The White Knight 2017 Viognier (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: The nose offers warm honey and orange blossom aromas accented with baking spice. It starts with fresh citrus and stone fruit tones leading to a strange bitterness and oily texture on the palate.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Trump 2017 Estate Bottled Viognier (Monticello)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This jumbled wine is deep gold in color, offers extremely nutty and cidery aromas followed by flavors that are lean on the one hand and honeyed on the other. It's not easy being organic.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Frey 2016 Organic Viognier (Lodi)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There are hints of peach custard and warm brioche on the nose of this bottling, yet it's wrapped in a steely, focused shell, with a hint of lime skin freshness. It's crisp and grippy on the palate, where Meyer lemon and pan-seared apple flavors are lifted by a pinch of sea salt.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Site 2017 Larner Vineyard Viognier (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Placer County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine smells and tastes effusively ripe and rich, offering vanilla, pear nectar and honey aromas followed by mouthfilling cream, peach and almond flavors. Nice to pair with cheese before or after a meal, or by itself as a dessert wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Wild Thing 2017 Damiano Vineyard Viognier (Placer County)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A touch cloudy in the glass, this bottling is tightly wound on the nose, offering aromas of lemon peel, chalk, riverstone and peach blossom. There is great tension to the zippy palate, where vibrant acidity delivers both a citrus tang and more rounded flavors of lychee and apple cider.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Denner 2017 Viognier (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied peach, honeydew, mint, brioche and a hint of steel show on the dynamic nose of this bottling. The palate offers a balanced weight and mouthfeel, carrying flavors of fresh lemon, yellow peach and a hint of mango.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Anglim 2017 Hastings Ranch Vineyard Viognier (Adelaida District)

Appellation: San Diego County, South Coast, California, US
Description: The grape does very well in the warmer environs near Escondido, starting with austere aromas of lime pith, wet stone and the lightest hint of pear flesh. It's restrained on the palate, touching on tropical fruit cocktail, poached pear and citrus spray, proving crisp and refreshing throughout.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hungry Hawk 2018 Estate Viognier (San Diego County)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Floral honeysuckle and gardenia dominate on the nose of this lovely white, briny in wet stone and a persistence of lemon zest. Crisp acidity provides a lightness of body around burly ripeness and weighty viscosity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Mengler Family Wines 2018 Hoot Owl Creek Viognier (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Floral, light and bright with a tension of exotic citrus, wet stone and flowers, this small-production white adheres to varietal correctness and a restrained approach to ripeness, opting instead for clarity and focus.                      Virginie Boone
Name: MacLaren 2018 Aida Gregori Vineyard Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Heightened aromas of honeysuckle and canned peach lead to ripe, full-bodied, almost unctuous stone fruit flavors that persist on the finish. There's a lot of enjoyment to be had.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Watermill 2018 Reyna Estate Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (OR))

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This light to medium-bodied wine shows a greenish tint in the light-gold color, vanilla and butter aromas, and a rich but not overripe flavor of lemon and butter.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Conduit 2018 Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is an extremely ripe version of Viognier, starting with powerful aromas of mango sorbet, candied honeysuckle and poached pear. The palate is also fruit-heavy with apple, pear, mango and more tropical tones.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Alara 2018 Viognier (San Benito County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Antoine Creek Vineyard provides the fruit for this wine. Aromas of peach, flower, reduction and herb lead to tart but still somewhat boozy-seeming stone fruit flavors. It's a strange mix.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Skagit 2018 Antoine Creek Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's immense freshness to the nose of this estate bottling, with freshly cut pluot and white-melon aromas. The palate sizzles with strong acidity and grabs hold with a tense structure, tucking the flavors of peach and melon behind a chalky frame.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Zotovich 2018 Viognier (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Floral, grassy and steely in style, this wine is lightly balanced with a freshness that appeals. The flavors are a mix of apricot and lemon peel unfettered by oak and measured in ripeness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: DRNK 2017 Catie's Corner Vineyard Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Alentejano, Portugal
Description: A fascinating wine with ripe tropical fruits, apricots and mangoes along with a succulent juiciness that is now generously integrated into the full-bodied texture. After five years, the wine is definitely mature and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2016 Dona Maria Amantis Reserva Viognier (Alentejano)

Appellation: Knights Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Viscous in honeycomb and green-apple flavor, this is a well-made version of the variety, elegant with a hearty midpalate of richness and concentration.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Lawer 2017 Betsy's Vineyard Viognier (Knights Valley)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Marigolds lead the nose on this gleeful Viognier joined by clementines and nectarines. The palate is juicy and bright offering flavors of ripe summer peach, Asian pear and lemon juice. Lime pith enters on the finish, with more ripe peach lingering deliciously.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Jefferson Vineyards 2018 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Very light in the glass, this bottling is exuberant on the nose with freshly smashed papaya, mango and pineapple aromas, proving tropical yet clean. There is a taut tension to the palate, which balances the ripe jasmine and tuberose flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Falkner 2018 Viognier (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Supremely floral, crisp and steely, this wine shines in bold flavors of apple, lemon and honey, with an unsuspecting viscosity. It shows a hit of ripeness and heat on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hawley 2018 Viognier (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: Fresh cut lemons, sweet grasses and white flowers create a summer haze on nose. This is bright on the palate with juicy acidity, lemon juice, apple, canary melon and borage blossom. Papaya, dandelion and lemon juice round out the finish.                      Fiona Adams
Name: The Williamsburg Winery 2018 Limited Release Viognier (Monticello)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Loads of pollen, dandelions and tangy fruit qualities define a clean-smelling nose. The palate combines kumquat and Meyer lemon with grassiness towards the finish, ending with a sprinkling of white pepper.                      Fiona Adams
Name: The Williamsburg Winery 2018 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Deep gold with an orangey tinge in the glass, the nose offers Mandarin, pear and subtle floral and warm spice notes. There is welcome acidity on the astringent palate presenting flavors of baked pears, preserved oranges, kumquat and flower petals. The finish is loaded with cinnamon and clove alongside preserved lemon.                      Fiona Adams
Name: The Williamsburg Winery 2018 Wessex Hundred Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Light on the nose at first, this wine opens toward aromas of honey, nectarine, Asian pear and scratched grapefruit skin. The palate is quite clean but lands with a surprisingly sweet touch, offering ripe pear-syrup flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Wilson Creek 2018 Chloe Vineyard Viognier (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas seem to lack definition, with notes of herb, citrus and lees. Medium-bodied slightly creamy-feeling flavors follow. The variety doesn't seem to show itself, though it still provides enjoyment.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Elephant Seven 2018 Blue Mountain Vineyard Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of wilted flower, Mandarin orange and peach lead to a full-bodied, oily-feeling palate. A warm, bitter finish caps it off.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Columbia Winery 2018 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Pronounced rose, lychee and peach-candy aromas form the nose of this golden-hued wine, with a honeyed jasmine-white-tea edge. The palate is round, full and flat, with a slick, viscous feel and plump, ripe peach and apricot flavors that linger on the close.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Florent Descombe 2018 Viognier (Vin de France)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Outrageous aromas of freshly cut white peach, nectarine, wet stone and honeysuckle lead to intensely flavorful peach and apricot notes that retain a sense of deftness. The finish persists an easy 30 seconds. It brings impressive energy, balance and intensity. To those who don't believe minerality exists, this wine serves as a counterpoint to the argument.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Cayuse 2017 Cailloux Vineyard Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light in the glass, this bottling from the northern edge of the small appellation shows plenty of honeydew as well as guava and ripe apple on the nose, all set against a chalky backbone. There's great grip on the sip, where chalky texture and bright acidity frame the baked apple and pear flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Section Wines 2018 Tierra Alta Vineyards Viognier (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From a vineyard named after the winery's late founder Linda Rice, this is a very crisp, clean and light style of Viognier, starting with aromas of lemon-lime soda, guava peel and apple blossoms. The zesty palate offers more guava and golden-apple flesh, all wrapped up in a tight weave.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Sunstone 2018 Linda's Vineyard Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are intriguing, with notes of mineral, peach, herb and citrus. The palate is focused and flavorful, with a sleek styling to the seamless stone fruit flavors. A tart finish follows. It's notably fresh and vibrant for this often ponderous variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Gramercy 2018 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The aromatics lean heavily into the botanical spectrum, almost gin-like, and the flavors feature lemon verbena, citrus rind and grapefruit. There's also a touch of honeysuckle, which elevates both the nose and the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: 2Hawk 2018 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An inaugural release from the winery, this wine comes from one of the state's premier Viognier vineyards. There are intriguing details to the aromas, with notes of white peach, citrus and herb. A sleek, flavorful, acid-driven palate follows. It's a fascinating example of the variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Prospice 2018 Gamache Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The scent of white flowers comes across at first, along with a splash of citrus oil. The fruit flavors combine lemon and tart orange. There's a quick finish, but the overall balance is just right.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Amalie Robert 2017 Our Muse Viognier (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Lightly scented with gin-like botanical aromas, notably citrus rind and juniper, this rather delicate but nicely integrated wine carries that floral-herbal character on through the finish. It's quite refreshing and deftly balanced.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Dobbes Family Estate 2018 Sundown Vineyard Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light in the glass, this bottling shows aromas of grilled nectarine and light lemon pith on the nose. The palate is very tight, offering lemon peel and yellow-apple flavors with the slightest hint of smoke.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Koehler 2017 Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cantaloupe, baked orange, white peach and a hint of smoke show on the tropical-leaning nose of this single-vineyard bottling. Baked lemon, plumeria, guava and smoke combine for the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bellante 2018 Jack McGinley Vineyard Viognier (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Flinty aromas of struck stone and smoke meet with sour lemon peels on the nose of this bottling. The palate is tart, with apple and pear skins and grapefruit-juice flavors, proving pleasantly crisp.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Dusty Nabor 2018 The Florist Viognier (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Broad aromas of yellow pear, mango and hints of banana show on the ripe and aggressive nose of this bottling. There is compelling tension to the palate, where flavors of banana and mango are cut by a lemony acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Eberle 2018 Mill Road Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Carmel Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tonic-like aromas of lime peels, grapefruit pith and other botanicals meet with a light touch of smoke on the nose of this bottling. There is a good sizzle to the sip, which cuts into the midpalate sweetness of apples and pears before leading into a chalky finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Galante 2018 Viognier (Carmel Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Mellow aromas of wet slate, lime and Meyer lemon make for a pleasant entry on the nose of this wine. The palate is also delicate, with a unique hint of herb and truffle adding to the light lemon backdrop.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: MCV 2018 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Gardenia, honeysuckle and lime peel aromas show on the nose of this bottling, which veers toward earth and animal flesh at times. It tightens on the palate, offering green-apple flesh and more lime flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bellante 2018 Camp 4 Vineyard Viognier (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of vanilla, baking spice, peach and cream are followed by full-bodied fruit flavors, redolent with vanilla notes. A quite warm finish follows. The wood (and perhaps lees influence?) get in the way of the fruit, which is a shame as what can be seen is wonderful.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Eternal 2017 Eternal Sunshine Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: The nose of this wine is delicate but perfumed, wafting of orange blossom, apricot and honeycomb. Full bodied and glycerol on the palate, it offers layers of tangerine and stone-fruit flavors edged by a pleasant ring of bitters. This powerful yet pretty wine will be best enjoyed now through 2026.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: François Villard 2016 Villa Pontciana  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This gorgeously tropical Viognier bursts from nose to palate with notes of fresh, concentrated melon, guava and pineapple. It's juicy and richly textured but remarkably spry, edged by layers of crushed stone and a floral kiss on the finish. Enjoyable now it should develop depth through 2026.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Martin Clerc 2016  Condrieu

Description: This is a sultry Viognier packed with yellow-peach and tangerine flavors. Its glossy texture is magnified by skeins of vanilla cream and notes of honeysuckle and spice. The finish clings with a delightfully silken touch.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Vignobles Verzier 2015 R  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Lavender and tangerine skins meld into granite tones on the nose of this silky, supple Viognier. Melon and apricot flavors are concentrated and fresh on the palate, offset by sunny acidity and a salty, mineral finish. This voluptuous but elegant wine should drink well through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: François Villard 2016 Le Grand Vallon  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Intense aromas of apricot and orange cream burst from this lavish, concentrated Viognier. It's creamy and unctous in texture but brightened by sunny tangerine acidity and a pleasant bite of tannins. It's a classic and elegant Condrieu.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Xavier Gérard 2016 Côte Châtillon  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Zesty mineral tones and fresh acidic balance lend an invigorating tone to this aromatic dry white. Honeysuckle and apricot flavors are pristine and crisp. It's a freshly fruited but elegant Condrieu to enjoy now through 2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: M. Chapoutier 2016 Invitare  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This creamy, lavishly textured Viognier ripples with cantaloupe, orange and vanilla flavors. It's concentrated and finishes on bold, penetrating flares of honeysuckle and apricot notes as well as a pleasant bite of tannins.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: François Villard 2016 Deponcins  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Creamy swirls of vanilla-orange ice cream and honeydew melon dominate this unctuous but pertly balanced Viognier. It's silky and richly concentrated but maintains an elegant, sunny appeal. The finish is long and tangerine scented.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Maison Denuzière 2016 J. Denuzière  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Delicate whiffs of orange blossom and smoked nut contrast with the concentrated tangerine and apricot flavors on the palate of this wine. It's creamy and lip smacking, with a long, honeyed finish.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Gilles Flacher 2016 Les Rouelles  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Tropical melon and pineapple flavors abound in this sunny, silk-textured wine. Plump and concentrated, it's brightened by streaks of tangerine candy and spice. The finish is long and lavish but wraps up neatly on a fringe of bitter tea tannins. Enjoy now–2022.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Gilles Flacher 2015 Les Rouelles  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Orange blossom and white peach perfume this plump but freshly balanced Viognier. Tropical melon, banana and citrus flavors are ripe but crisply concentrated. The finish is pristine and mineral. Enjoy now–2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Pichat 2016 La Caile  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Arresting aromas of wet stone, talc, honey-drizzled peach and apricot are followed by full-bodied, mineral-laden flavors, showing exceptional balance, length and depth. There is a savory aspect of the wine that heightens the interest. A long finish follows. It's a standout.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Designation: Estate White In the Rocks Vineyard
Name: Reynvaan Family Vineyards 2017 Estate White In the Rocks Vineyard Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Penetrating white peach and apricot flavors are accented by spicy hits of anise and white pepper in this wine. It's lavish and round but brightened by sunny tangerine acidity and a pleasant rim of bitters on the finish.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Gabriel Meffre 2015 Laurus  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Fresh lime and mint lend an invigorating tone to tangerine and apricot in this unusually fresh expression of Condrieu. Stone-fruit flavors are ripe and concentrated but balanced briskly by sunny lemon acidity. The finish lingers on a slick of honeycomb.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Vignobles Verzier 2016 Authentic  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Crisp notes of lemon, tangerine and dried thyme accent apricot and honeysuckle in this slender, silky Viognier. It's full bodied but refreshingly spry. The finish is moderately long and fringed by delicate tea tannins.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Benjamin et David Duclaux 2016 Les Caillets  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: While the nose is restrained, apricot and honeysuckle are primary and pure on the palate of this briskly balanced Viognier. While full bodied and plump, it's juicy and easy drinking, nuanced by hints of blossom, earth and wax that linger.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Vallet 2016 Rouelle-Midi  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine opens with a sweet nose of candied fruit and flowers, the texture velvety and robust in viscous intensity. A taste of apple skin and lemon lingers for awhile on the palate, with a lasting note of wet stone.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Chappellet 2017 Cold Creek Vineyard Viognier (Carneros)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a hearty, expressive 100% varietal wine, floral in honeysuckle and gardenia, with a lovely entry of succulent citrus. Complex and elegant, it dazzles in minerality—a mix of stone and earth that works on every level.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Krupp Brothers 2018 Stagecoach Vineyard Viognier (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Given six months in neutral barrel, this is an effervescent, lively white, with tension and focus on the palate. Sweet peach, apple and mineral-like stone add to inviting aromas of white flower as the wine finishes dry and with power.                      Virginie Boone
Name: McKahn 2018 Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine was aged six months in 60% stainless steel and 40% neutral oak. The aromas provide notes of melon, flower petal, pear, cinnamon and whole nectarine. Medium-bodied stone fruit flavors follow. It piques the interest, with a lovely sense of acidity for the variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Forgeron 2018 Francisca's Vineyard Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas draw you into the glass, with reserved notes of peach nectar, flower and pear. Light on their feet fruit flavors follow. It brings a compelling sense of minerality and balance.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Saviah 2017 Saviah Estate Vineyard Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Smoky, intensely earthen aromas dissipate with aeration, revealing fresher tones of orange blossom and apricot in this wine. It's unctuous and richly textured, marked by waxy swirls of honeycomb and cream. The finish is marked by bitter hints of bramble and bee pollen.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Benjamin et David Duclaux 2015 Les Caillets  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Intensely ripe apricot and peach flavors are edged by prominent notes of toast, bramble and earth in this wine. The palate is creamy and a bit bulky in mouthfeel but brightened by hits of tangerine acidity. The finish is marked by a whisper of heat.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Chambeyron 2016 Vernon  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Heady guava and mango notes are layered in caramel and honey in this fleshy, softly textured Viognier. It's yielding and open, with a slightly warming finish. Enjoy young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Vidal-Fleury 2016  Condrieu

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Restrained aromas of ripe pear flesh, apple blossom and guava show on the nose of this bottling from Terra Mia Vineyard. The palate is also reserved, just allowing enough of the guava and tuberose flavors to emerge.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Pulchella 2018 Drifter Viognier (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Lazio, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Made with Viognier, this has a shy nose that eventually reveals white flower and fennel aromas. The straightforward palate offers apricot and grapefruit. Enjoy soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Gaffino 2017 Foietta Viognier (Lazio)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light touches of wet concrete, yellow grapefruit and chalk make for a very subtle and mineral-driven nose on this bottling. There is a great chalky grip to the palate, whose tense structure allows flavors of lime in and jasmine to slowly emerge.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Thacher 2017 Hastings Ranch Vineyard Viognier (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Poised and balanced, this medium- to full-bodied wine boasts apricot and peach-skin aromas, lively fruit flavors backed by good acidity, and a mouthfilling texture that is soothing on the finish, where it releases extended nutty and vanillin impressions. Expect it to gain more complexity through 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sol Rouge 2016 Viognier (Lake County)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied, fabulous wine captures both the rich, nutty quality that Viognier can show and a leaner, more tangy aspect. Mineral and hazelnut aromas set the stage for vibrant peach and apricot flavors that swirl into a savory mineral finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Locke 2016 Viognier (Calaveras County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Big, bold butter and toast flavors and a rich, almost thick texture make this full-bodied wine imposing. Grown at 2,500-feet elevation, it is nicely viscous, flooding the palate with butterscotch, hazelnut and almond notes that linger on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Cedarville 2017 Estate Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Both this reserve and the winery's regular 2017 Viognier are interesting, well-made wines, but for different reasons. Here the fruit seems to have been riper, and the flavors are full and round, with a mix of pineapple, peach and apple. The regular bottling leans more to the herbal, botanical side of the grape. Both work well.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Cowhorn 2017 Reserve Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of white peach, sea salt and light guava cream show on the nose of this well-restrained bottling. The flavors are tropical with guava, pineapple and tuberose, but very tightly wound. Serve very cold to keep the riper tones in check.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Sculpterra 2017 Heroe Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Wonderfully aromatic, this beguiles from the get-go with well-woven scents of honeysuckle and lavender. It's firm rather than flowery on the palate, focused on steely flavors of mixed herbs and botanicals, and finishing with a burst of orange crush.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Cowhorn 2017 Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This well-balanced wine starts off floral and fresh in aroma, then gains more weight, richness and ripeness on the palate, yielding ripe pear and a touch of honey as well as a mouthfilling texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Rock Wall 2017 Kristen's Del Arroyo Vineyard Viognier (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: South Australia, South Australia, Australia
Description: Yalumba was one of Viognier's early champions Down Under, and while its everyday bottling isn't mind-blowing, it's nevertheless a solid and mouthwatering drop. It starts with peach and apple skin, with honey and florals in the picture as well. The palate is creamy and tangy, with bright fruit and crisp, lifted acidity and a spicy note on the finish.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Yalumba 2017 Viognier (South Australia)

Appellation: Yarra Valley, Victoria, Australia
Description: This pale gold wine offers a nose of ripe orchard fruit, fresh spring blossoms, honey and a touch of salted nuts. The palate is quite ripe and oily in texture, with more nuttiness. There's enough acidity to keep this from feeling flabby, but just barely.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Yeringberg 2016 Viognier (Yarra Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This silky wine has generous melon and pear aromas, a mouthfilling texture and ripe but not overt flavors of honeydew melon and pear nectar accented by light floral notes.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Naggiar 2018 Root 49 Estate Viognier (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the inaugural release of this wine from this newcomer. Appealing aromas of peach, lime and minerality lead to sleek, dry, tart fruit flavors. It's a strong start that eschews the often ponderous route this variety can take, choosing instead deftness.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Fortuity 2017 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Eden Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: This barrel-fermented Viognier from South Australia's Eden Valley bursts with bright peach, lemon-lime and honeysuckle. Vanillin oak lurks in the background. The palate is textural and chalky, the fruit juicy and the acidity lifted, avoiding the flabby trap this variety sometimes falls prey to. A straightforward but refreshing, textural drop.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Tim Smith 2018 Viognier (Eden Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Floral aromas and fresh straightforward fruit flavors make this medium-bodied wine attractive and palate pleasing. It has good acidity and a mouth-cleansing quality that's well-suited for lunch or dinner.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sobon Estate 2018 Viognier (Amador County)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of creamsicle, ripe peach, crayon and flower lead to quite ripe, full-bodied stone fruit flavors. It runs warm.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Milbrandt 2017 The Estates Viognier (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine shows an unusually deep gold color, nutty, savory aromas and a well-aged flavor of toasted almonds, oak spices and honey. It's dry but has the flavor profile of a late harvest wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Latent 2017 Tanner Vineyards Viognier (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Fermented entirely in stainless steel, this reliably excellent wine is once again deeply fruited with mixed citrus, honeysuckle and Bosc pear. A pleasing minerality underscores the zesty finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Penner-Ash 2017 Viognier (Oregon)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light and floral aromas of plumeria, tangy Meyer lemon and a stronger peach tone show on the nose of this bottling. There is a great crispness and lively aspect to the palate, where zesty lime flavors lift the rounder apple and pear flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Refugio Ranch 2017 Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A light and pretty nose, this bottling offers aromas of honeysuckle, ripe Pink Lady apple and a hint of sweet cream. It's very tightly wound on the palate, showing a strong chalky texture at first before the waves of poached apple and peach arise.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Kaena 2017 Tierra Alta Vineyard Viognier (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is fermented and aged in stainless steel with no secondary fermentation. It opens in floral honeysuckle and a hint of fresh grass, with notes of peach and tropical vanilla. Lively acidity boosts its light-bodied frame.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Ampelos 2018 Phi Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crisp and taut on the nose, this bottling offers aromas of freshly cut key lime and apple blossom. The palate is also crisp and expertly restrained, with flavors of apple syrup, orange rind and tropical-leaning peach steadily arising.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Larner 2017 Viognier (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lightly poached pear, honeysuckle, white peach, butter and chiseled sandstone aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's full on the palate with yellow peach, crisp pear rind and grapefruit peel flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Kaena 2016 Tierra Alta Vineyard Viognier (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: This Viognier is bursting with ripe fruit aromas of papaya and pineapple, laced with honeycomb and chamomile. Slightly off dry, the aromas resonate on the palate and are joined by an aloe note. Full in body, with a round mouthfeel, the finish is long and creamy.                      Carrie Dykes
Name: Pippin Hill Farm 2017 Lot No. 003 Viognier (Monticello)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: New winemaker Andy McVay debuts with this vintage, showing a warm and generous style right off the bat with this lush and lovely Viognier. Citrus and peach fruit is accented with cucumber, jicama and green melon. It trails off gently into a fresh finish with a touch of wet stone.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Dobbes Family Estate 2017 Sundown Vineyard Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Light gold in color, this opens with an assertive toasted oak character, coupled with notes of grilled apple, peach pit, candied orange peel and pie crust. The palate is light in weight but soft in acidity, with round, mouthfilling flavors of wood-grilled apple, honeycomb and lightly toasted brioche. A honeyed nuttiness lingers on the enduring finish.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Domaine de la Baume 2016 Terres Viognier (Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: This highly aromatic wine smells fresh and herbal, with pronounced notes of sweet grass, orange blossom and touches of gingered pear and green fig. The palate is light and zippy, with good acidity and a pleasant freshness that's expressed in flavors of lime and orange zest. The finish is clean and bright, with a mouthwatering persistence.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Domaine de la Baume 2017 Elisabeth Viognier (Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas intrigue, with notes of dried apricot, apple and spice. The fruit flavors are light, coming up short on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Maison Bleue 2016 Votligeur Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: This is a pretty representation of the variety's typical character, with notes of fresh peach, lychee and yellow melon on the nose and mouth, all hit by floral accents of crushed rose petal. Medium weight and smooth on the palate, it has a slick but not viscous texture and ample acidity to lift the ripe tropical-fruit tones.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Les Tannes en Occitanie 2017 Viognier (Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a bulky, blocky wine, with chunky fruit flavors of peach and banana. It's 100% varietal, a forward fruit bomb of a wine that will be best over the next couple of years.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Del Rio 2017 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: A subtle note of lemon verbena is coupled with hints of crushed chalk, underripe guava, tart peach and melon rind on the delicate nose of this wine. The palate is surprisingly round and fleshy in feel, with notes of peach, fig and sweet orange. Acidity is soft and light, lending just enough lift to the ripe fruit tones to keep the wine from feeling flabby or flat.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Les Jamelles 2017 Viognier (Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: There's a slightly reductive tone to the nose of this wine, with a hint of struck match that blows off with air. Beyond that, notes of ripe pineapple, honeydew and a touch of honeysuckle unfold on the nose, while the medium-weight palate is enlivened by enduring flavors of pithy melon rind and orange acidity. A honeyed character lingers on the end.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Domaine du Chateau d'Eau 2016 Organic Viognier (Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Sharply etched with strong botanical flavors, this young Viognier is dominated by acidity, herb, phenolics and a dominating flavor of lemon rind.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Foon 2017 Viognier (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made with 100% Viognier, this opens with aromas of apricot, toast and an earthy note. The structured palate offers ripe yellow peach, lemon zest and vanilla while a hazelnut note wraps up the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Michele Satta 2016 Giovin Re Viognier (Toscana)

Appellation: Hawke's Bay, New Zealand
Description: This Viognier avoids the overly fruity, flabby pitfalls that sometimes befall the variety. Instead, subtle aromas of peach pit, lemon, grapefruit and honeysuckle lead gently into a medium-bodied palate that is textural yet delicate, with honey and floral flavors at the fore. Pithy stone fruit at the finish is a refreshing close.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Decibel 2016 Bridge PA Vineyard Viognier (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very pleasant and soft aromas of light honeysuckle, yellow melon and creamy peach show on the nose of this bottling from a clone imported by the Bonny Doon founder. Tangy and fresh apple-skin flavors meet with slightly sweet melon elements on the broad palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Cooper-Garrod 2017 Randall Grahm Clone Viognier (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Fruit for this typically Snake River Valley designated wine comes from Washington due to a 2017 Idaho freeze. Generous aromas of peach, orange essence and flower are followed by bone-dry fruit flavors, with peach notes lingering on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Cinder 2017 Dry Viognier (Washington)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Chunky tropical aromas include notes of melon, banana and mango. A full-bodied palate is more broad and blocky than precise, while upfront papaya and quince flavors are short prior to a salty finish with almost no fruit character.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Siegel 2017 Special Reserve Viognier (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Maule Valley, Chile
Description: An orange color and soft, quiet aromas of cantaloupe, peach and apricot are as good as this oddball Viognier gets. A flat palate holds oxidized flavors of caramel and bitter nuts but not much fruit, while a drying finish gets its texture from grape skins and tannins.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Puente Austral 2017 Viognier (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rounded and plump aromas of lime blossom, sweet apple, oak and nuts are cut by a wet stone minerality on the nose of this bottling. The palate is much tighter than expected, with a zingy lemon quality that keeps the warmer apple, peach and sea salt flavors in check.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Pelletiere 2017 Viognier (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Delicate floral and mineral aromas in this medium-bodied wine turn to rich white-peach flavors on the palate. It has very good balance, and tastes clean and refreshing while also revealing depth and a lingering finish. Barrel fermented, it offers subtlety and satisfaction at the same time.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Starfield 2016 Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Made entirely from one variety in collaboration with winemaker Yves Gangloff, this imparts a subtle floral nose of jasmine and a fresh spritzy midpalate of juicy acidity. Well made and complex, it melds together bold layered flavors of lemon peel, melon and apricot into a cohesive, full-bodied and concentrated whole.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Jeff Cohn 2016 2 Guys 2 Barrels Stagecoach Vineyard Viognier (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Alentejano, Portugal
Description: Named after the Roman tiles (telhas) which are regularly found in the vineyard, this pure Viognier is grown at a high elevation. That gives it the essential coolness and acidity to balance its naturally rich yellow-fruit flavors. This nutmeg flavored,spicy wine is now fully balanced and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Terras de Alter 2017 Terra d'Alter Telhas Branco Viognier (Alentejano)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is from certified-organic fruit that has been fermented in stainless steel, showing a fresh lively profile of textured peach, melon and coconut flavors. Steely and demure, it persists in jasmine aromas and a hint of honey.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Ampelos 2017 Phi Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine was aged in both neutral oak and stainless steel, the grapes from a famous corner of Saralee Kunde's sought-after vineyard. Peach and anise show on the nose and palate. It is velvety in texture, with notes of jasmine and crushed rock that offer brightness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Aver Family Vineyards 2017 Benevolent Catie's Corner Vineyard Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are expressive, with notes of white flower and ripe peach along with a kiss of vanilla and barrel spice. A full-bodied, dense palate follows, leading to a long, quite warm finish. There are good things going on, but they don't all come together, with the balance seeming a bit off.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Force Majeure 2017 Estate Viognier (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With 6% Chardonnay and 1% Gewürztraminer, this is a well-made white that shows pretty aromas of honeysuckle on the nose. Viscous on the palate, with elements of apricot, lime and stone, it has a creamy lushness within a balanced frame of fresh acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Kunde 2017 Estate Grown Viognier (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This fruity and generous wine shows peach aromas, apricot flavors, good crisp acidity and enough body to balance it. The texture is tangy and edgy and keeps the taste buds alert.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Steele 2017 Viognier (Lake County)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Previously marketed as Louloute, this new Viognier is unusually low in alcohol and features sharp herbal flavors of bitter grapefruit. It's far off the beaten path for this hot climate grape, yet potent and penetrating, with potential for distinctive food pairings. It was fermented in stainless and aged on the lees for about seven months.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Lexème 2016 Viognier (Oregon)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fermented and aged in neutral French oak, this has an opening earthiness and jasmine profile that leads to structured, moderate acidity and plush viscous layers of baked apricot. It's hearty and full bodied.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Pride Mountain 2017 Viognier (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Grand Valley, Colorado, US
Description: This wine offers fresh aromas of apricots and peaches, with hints of lychee and honeysuckle on the nose. The palate is refreshing in flavors of ripe white peach, lemon juice, white flowers and crushed minerals. A steely, mineral finish carries swaths of lime zest and white pepper.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Snowy Peaks 2017 Viognier (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Galilee, Israel
Description: Aromas of apple and freesia prepare the palate for flavors of green apple, pear and sage. This wine is smooth in the mouth, with a soft floral finish.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: Dalton 2017 Reserve Viognier (Galilee)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All of the fruit for this wine comes from Antoine Creek Vineyard, north of the Lake Chelan appellation. Aromas of lemon balm, white peach and honeysuckle are followed by generous but still sleekly styled fruit flavors that show beautiful depth, balance and tension. Lemony acidity heightens the interest. The winery's best offering of this variety to date.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Gramercy 2017 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Pure varietal, this is as perfectly-ripened as Viognier can ever be. Rich, smooth flavors of melon and tangerine with zesty notes of Meyer lemon push the fruit forward, with underlying minerality keeping the lengthy finish fresh and invigorating. Drink now and over the next two or three years.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Quady North 2017 Steelhead Run Vineyard Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Guava and bubblegum aromas are very clean and cut by a steely edge on the nose. The palate tightens up considerably, offering tense lemon skin and chalky tones against rounded white-peach and guava flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Crū 2017 French Camp Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fruit for this wine comes from a vineyard at 1,300 feet of elevation—high for the state. All aged in neutral French oak, the wine has aromas that bring notes of ripe peach, apricot and flower. Full-bodied, well-structured stone fruit and creamsicle flavors follow. There's much to enjoy.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: K Vintners 2017 Art Den Hoed Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From the Riboli family's new vineyard named after the patriarch, this bottling offers tuberose and tropical aromas of mango and papaya cream on the nose, but with a chalky edge. The palate is clean and crisp in flavors of lemon curd and apple mousse.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: San Simeon 2017 Stefano Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Simonsberg-Paarl, South Africa
Description: There's a floral, spicy lift to the nose of this wine, with aromas of ginger-peach tea, honeysuckle, spiced pear and nectarine that fill the bouquet. The medium-weight palate shows a bit of heft on the midpalate, with waves of peach, nectarine, rose and honeysuckle flavors. There's just enough acidity to lift the sweet-flavor impressions, while the finish is all floral.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Noble Hill 2016 Viognier (Simonsberg-Paarl)

Appellation: Similkameen Valley, British Columbia, Canada
Description: As the near 15% alcohol would suggest, this is a fully-ripened wine, pushing the grape's flavors into a rich, round, peachy realm. In so doing, it avoids the bitterness that can plague underripe Viognier, but feels just a little flabby in the mouth.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Vanessa 2017 Viognier (Similkameen Valley)

Appellation: Western Cape, South Africa
Description: This is slightly warm on the nose, with spiced melon and citrus peel aromas that are coupled with grapefruit pith and green apple accents. The medium-weight palate offers just enough acidity to lift the ripe fruit flavors and sweet orange impression.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Babylonstoren 2016 Viognier (Western Cape)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: An uncommon offering of sweet Viognier, this bottling shows honeydew, crushed stone and orange peel on the nose. It's a tad oily on the palate with petrol-laced flavors of sour lime peel.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lion Ranch NV VP Viognier (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Subdued aromas of peach and herb are followed by spritzy, full-bodied stone fruit flavors. The variety's intensity and joy seem to be missing                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Tamarack Cellars 2017 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Beautifully floral and inviting, this wine has a nice weight to it and a balanced approach to ripeness and acidity. Peach, lemon and wet stone carry through a midpalate of silky smoothness and peppery finish. This is an impressive version of the variety.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Anaba 2017 Landa Vineyard Viognier (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Yamhill-Carlton, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Tightly wound and bursting with botanical highlights, there is a ginlike flavor to this pure varietal expression. Power and precision abound, and the long, phenolic finish, bone dry and detailed, defines this as a wine worth exploring and experimenting with as far as companion foods.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Brooks 2017 Deux Vert Vineyard Viognier (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine has light aromas of figs and crushed stone, followed by a creamy mouthfeel and subtle flavors of almond and white pepper. A couple of years in the cellar will bring out more complexity. Best after 2020.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lava Cap 2017 Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean aromas of pomelo and lychee meet with peach and dried sour pear on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. Tangy citrus and grapefruit flavors ride an energetic mouthfeel, with a long-lasting acid that takes a sour stretch into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Jaffurs 2017 Bien Nacido Vineyard Viognier (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine begins with ripe bubblegum, peach, pear-syrup and Stargazer lily aromas, although those start to fade into more mineral tones as it sits open. The sip is quite tight, with lemony acidity and a chalky frame constraining the peachy flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Margerum 2017 Margerum Estate Vineyard Viognier (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Aged 10 months in neutral American oak, this wine has a thick gritty texture and a sweetness of peach, green apple and honey. The structure and acidity are moderate; the ripeness full bodied and intense.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Mengler Family Wines 2017 Hoot Owl Creek Vineyard Viognier (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are generous, with notes of melon, white flower, pear and peach. The apricot and peach flavors are full bodied, sweet, ripe and nectarous with a warm finish. It delivers a lot of appeal, though the apparent residual sugar runs a bit high.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Maryhill 2017 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crushed sandstone and flinty mineral aromas meet with a slightly reductive nose on this bottling. The palate is very tightly wound with grassy lime-skin flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Black Ridge 2014 Viognier (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light aromas of honeydew and honey show on the restrained nose of this bottling. The palate is all about a tight texture, with springtime flavors of white flowers and lime pith showing through.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Castoro Cellars 2017 Dos Vinas Vineyard Reserve Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean honeydew, lime balm and peach-orange aromas meet with vanilla and white-rock aromas on the nose of this bottling. There is a flash of sweetness to the palate, where ripe apple and pear flavors combine with lemon syrup.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Ferguson Crest 2017 Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This is a medium-weight wine that balances subtle floral and orange-zest characters against suggestions of vanilla and butter that build on the palate and add richness on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Oak Grove 2017 Family Reserve Viognier (California)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This dessert wine is quite sweet, with candied flavors of peach, apricot and papaya. It shows a decent balance between concentrated fruit tones and bright acidity.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Apolloni 2014 Dolce Vino Viognier (Oregon)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is an oily viscous white, nutty with floral elements of jasmine and rose. A dense dry texture rides below lemon verbena and stone-fruit flavors.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Domenica Amato 2017 Salomon Vineyard Viognier (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Nicely crisp and dry, this medium-bodied wine smells floral and tastes a bit leesy like it just came out of a barrel. It has tangy lemon and green-apple flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sera Fina 2017 Viognier (Amador County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lighter-styled aromas of herb and flower are followed by medium-sweet fruit flavors, with wilted flower notes on the finish. There's not enough acid to balance the sugar.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Wilridge 2017 Broetje Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Placer County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This charming wine offers richness backed by well-honed acidity, so it stays fresh on the palate through the finish. Light baking-spice and honeysuckle aromas lead to subtle vanilla and white-peach flavors that enhance the smooth mouthfeel.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Le Casque 2017 Damiano Vineyard Viognier (Placer County)

Appellation: Sonoma Mountain, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a smooth, balanced and lovely dessert wine, moderate in sweetness and heat, with lovely aromas and flavors of rose water, fresh and dried apricot and honeycomb. It will do well on its own, or as an accompaniment to a wide range of cheeses and spicy desserts.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Belden Barns NV Estate Late Harvest Viognier (Sonoma Mountain)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a strong stony aroma on the nose of this well-shaped bottling, along with Meyer lemon pith and dried nectarine elements. The palate is streamlined with yellow-peach and citrus-peel flavors, with a full mouthfeel that is leveled by balanced acidity and a firm texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Sarah's Vineyard 2016 Estate Viognier (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light and clean with even aromas of peach syrup, concentrated honeydew and a hint of wood, this fresh and bright bottling from a winery whose name means “gold” in Hawaiian includes 6% Picpoul Blanc. Citrusy flavors start the palate as the tropical touches linger in the background, wrapped in a racy texture with lots of zing into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Kula 2017 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very subtle on the nose, aromas of ripe pear and honeydew emerge with patience, as do mineral streaks of chalk and wet cement. There is abundant energy to the sip, where gravel and chalk flavors linger in the forefront and bright key lime and hints of mango and papaya show on the backdrop.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: J. Lohr 2017 Gesture Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: River Junction, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This ripe and rich wine has orange blossom and honey aromas that lead to a palate of vanilla, orange and peach flavors. It displays a smooth, thick texture, with soft acidity and a creamy presence.                      Jim Gordon
Name: McManis 2017 Estate Grown Certified Sustainable Viognier (River Junction)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: This copper-colored wine, the result of eight days of skin-contact, opens with compelling aromas of wildflower, apricot and tilled red-earth. The earthy palate delivers orange zest, terracotta and rooibos tea. A tannic accent and zesty acidity lead into a long and layered finish.                      Carrie Dykes
Name: Jefferson Vineyards 2017 Skin Contact Viognier (Monticello)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
