Description: This very flavorful wine has plenty of apricot and peach flavors and a saline accent that sets it apart. It smells like almonds and dried apricots, and tastes vividly fruity and nicely crisp.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Naggiar 2017 Estate Viognier (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: A broad lychee aroma meets with a touch of ginger powder on the nose. Apricot and orange peel show on the full-bodied palate. It shows a pleasant roundness and weight, with a long, layered finish.                      Carrie Dykes
Name: Veritas 2016 Viognier (Monticello)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Very ripe aromas of guava bubblegum and key-lime pie are leveled by crushed gravel on the nose of this solid white wine from Temecula. Lime leaf and lemongrass show on the sip, which is Sauvignon Blanc-like and finishes with a flash of sweetness.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Wilson Creek 2017 Chloe Vineyard Winemaker's Select Viognier (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of guava, bubblegum and pink-grapefruit rinds show on the nose of this bottling from a winery in Massachusetts. The texture is a crunchy on the palate, offering flavors of dried apples, lime extract, a pinch of herbs and, on the finish, a nutty character.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Balderdash 2016 ‘Til Death Do Us Part Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of barrel spice, creamsicle and flower lead to medium-bodied fruit flavors and a warm finish. The oak influence seems a bit overweighted for the fruit in the bottle.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Gård 2015 Grand Klasse Reserve Lawrence Vineyards Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: This Viognier is nutty on the nose. A hints of an underripe papaya aroma is followed by a tangy impression on the palate. Oily in feel and full in body, the finish is long and flabby.                      Carrie Dykes
Name: Jefferson Vineyards 2017 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Texas, Texas, US
Description: Pear and apricot aromas are joined by a soapy gardenia note. The palate is ripe and loaded with peach, guava, lemon and rose. Blood orange acidity moves to a finish of apple and blossoms.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Landon 2016 Bingham Family Vineyards Viognier (Texas)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: Tight aromas of banana, white grape and juniper show on the nose of this Viognier. The ripe yet racy palate is framed by decent acidity, while delivering flavors of pastille candies and melon.                      Carrie Dykes
Name: Jefferson Vineyards 2017 Jefferson's Own Estate Reserve Viognier (Monticello)

Appellation: Texas, Texas, US
Description: Aromas of warm sugar cookie and baked pear carry the nose. The palate offers a bit more freshness in flavors of apple, lemon and hints of creamed butter and vanilla. The finish brings Bosc pear and lemon pith.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Pedernales 2016 Reserve Viognier (Texas)

Appellation: Texas, Texas, US
Description: Marigold flowers mingle with orange peel and white pepper on the nose. Naval orange and lemon flavors are muddle and tinged with a vegetal note on the palate. The finish offers pithy pink grapefruit and white pepper.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Grape Creek Vineyards 2016 Viognier (Texas)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of vanilla, wilted flower and stone fruit are followed by full-bodied, dry, lightly creamy feeling peach flavors. The oak seems a bit heavy-handed.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Waterbrook 2017 Icon Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are quite subdued for the variety, with light notes of flower and spice. The palate is medium bodied, focused down the middle with stone fruit flavors that taper at the edges.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Dusty Cellars 2017 Viognier (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Quiet tones of white flowers and citrus carry the nose and palate. This is a simple, straightforward white that would appeal to those looking for a light, crisp refresher.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Bedell 2016 Viognier (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Full flavored and rather full bodied, too, this wine exudes vivid and spicy aromas of pears, browned butter and toasted almonds, feels broad and mouthfilling and has softly ripe flavors. Light baking spices add complexity and a nicely viscous texture combines with good acidity for a lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Terre Rouge 2016 Viognier (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rounded honeysuckle, honey butter and seared white-peach aromas make for a fairly rich entry to this estate bottling. Yellow-peach and creamy mango flavors show on the sip, but the ripe fruit evolves into a savory sea salt and saffron side, finishing with a hint of pound cake.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Roblar 2017 Estate Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Fat in mouthfeel, waxy and earthy in aroma and rich, apricot-like and nutty in flavor, this wine emphasizes savory notes rather than fruity ones and richness in texture rather than crispness. Dried meats like prosciutto and salami could be great pairings.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Terre Rouge 2015 Viognier (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Maryland, Maryland, US
Description: This delightful Viognier offers aromas of ripe lemon, gooseberry, fresh cut grass and crushed white gravel on the nose. The palate is soft and caressing, but with plenty of mild mannered acidity to bolster flavors of peach, lemon-lime and rocks. It finishes on a white peach and lime juice note.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Big Cork Vineyards 2015 Viognier (Maryland)

Appellation: Grignan-les-Adhémar, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Lavish and perfumed, this full-bodied Viognier offers loads of musky floral, potpourri and grapefruit aromas. Dry in style, it's a plump, cream-textured wine balanced by soft citrus acidity and a flurry of tea-leaf bitters on the finish. Enjoy now–2022.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine de Montine 2017 Viognier (Grignan-les-Adhémar)

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very viscous and darkish yellow in the glass, this dessert wine offers fairly dainty aromas of smoke, oak and lemon sorbet. It's thick and sweet at first on the sip, but settles into honey and pleasant oak, with a savory roasted chicken finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Alara 2016 Late Harvest Viognier (San Benito County)

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Refreshing aromas of key lime, pear flesh and the slightest hint of sweet oak show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is crisp and tight with Asian pear and lime-pith flavors, wrapped in a decent tannic tension.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Alara 2017 Viognier (San Benito County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a tight weave on this bottling, which offers grapefruit rind and pear flesh on the nose alongside flint, steel and white-flower aromas. It's clean and crisp on the palate, with grassy flavors that are unusual for Viognier but quite welcome.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Eberle 2017 Mill Road Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Yadkin Valley, North Carolina, US
Description: Bright, grassy notes lead the nose with peach, lime juice and bell pepper. The round palate offers concentrated notes of beach grass, kumquat and more lime juice. Tingling acidity builds towards the zesty finish, loaded with yellow peach and white pepper.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Jones von Drehle 2015 Estate Viognier (Yadkin Valley)

Appellation: Idaho, US
Description: Fermented and aged in stainless steel, this wine is a blend of fruit from Sawtooth, Martin and Williamson vineyards. Bright aromas of tangerine, mouthwatering ripe peach and honeysuckle lead to plentiful stone fruit flavors that glide on the apricot-filled finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Cinder 2016 Dry Viognier

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: A bright blend of honeysuckle and mango flavors give plenty of personality to this medium-bodied, well-balanced wine. Bright acidity lifts the mouthfeel for a refreshing, but still rich flavor profile.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Cline 2017 Viognier (North Coast)

Appellation: Yadkin Valley, North Carolina, US
Description: The nose displays aromas of orange blossoms, gardenias, peach fuzz and green pears. The slick palate is zippy in flavors of Mandarin and lime, joined by sweet grass, yellow pepper and a hint of lemon pith.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Medaloni 2016 Viognier (Yadkin Valley)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Slightly cloudy in the glass, this bottling, featuring a great label by artist Ethan Stuart, starts with aromas of mashed-up lemons, crushed nuts, and oak. That smoky lemon tang shows strongly on the palate too, which verges on savory, with hints of roast chicken, sea salt and herbs.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Dusty Nabor 2017 The Florist Viognier (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Loads of white flowers meet with an orange-banana smoothie and sandalwood aromas on the nose of this bottling. The palate shows the sweetness of apple flesh with a rounded woody character, making for solid flavors even if the acid is a tad weak.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Falkner 2017 Viognier (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Peach and ripe apples meet with a strong kick of honeysuckle on the nose of this bottling, one of the few Viogniers from the appellation. There is decent tension to the palate, where more white flowers and pome-fruit flavors approach tropicality but are wrapped in a compelling texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Zotovich 2017 Viognier (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is one of the few examples of the variety coming out of this region. Slightly cloudy in color, the aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of peach, whole lime, mineral and wet stone. The palate is light but flavorful, with the concentration waxing and waning throughout.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Designation: In the Rocks Vineyard Estate White
Name: Reynvaan Family Vineyards 2016 In the Rocks Vineyard Estate White Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Carolina, North Carolina, US
Description: This orange Viognier, fermented on the skins, is cloudy in appearance, offering aromas of Mandarins, lychees, yellow peaches and fresh lillies. Drying tannins and a dandelion note distract from candied orange peel, dried flower and dried apicot flavors on the palate. A good effort, there is plenty of acidity for balance but the moderate finish of tea tannins and persimmons is lacking in concentration.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Sanctuary Vineyards 2016 Handcrafted Vin Orange Viognier (North Carolina)

Appellation: Colorado, Colorado, US
Description: This is a ripe wine, offering aromas of blossoms, gooseberries and pears. The exuberant palate doles out juicy lemons, apricots and apples, with touches of blossoms, white pepper and grass. Delicately balanced, this is light footed but carries some weight from the alcohol. It stays ripe through the finish, with a final wave of white peaches and white pepper pleasantly lingering.                      Fiona Adams
Name: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey 2017 Viognier (Colorado)
Winery: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey

Appellation: Grand Valley, Colorado, US
Description: This herbaceous Viognier dispalys aromas of tangerine, dandelion, pear and kale. The weightier palate shows ripe tangerine and nectarine balanced by fresh greens and a good kick of acidity flowing into a white peach and white pepper finish.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Grande River 2015 Viognier (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Cochise County, Arizona, US
Description: Shy notes of lemon peel, white flower, peach fuzz and clementine zest are slowly revealed on the nose. This has a round mouthfeel with gently tingling acidity. Flavors of nectarine and grapefruit are tinged with endives and are neutral in character, leading to a ripe lemon finish dusted with white pepper.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Page Springs 2014 Pillsbury Vineyard Viognier (Cochise County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An assertive oaky streak covers ripe apple and caramel flavors in this full-bodied wine. It shows pronounced aromas of charred wood and smoke in the aroma that continue on the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sobon Estate 2017 Viognier (Amador County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This is a soft-textured, medium-bodied wine with floral, earthy aromas and butterscotch flavors that come off as candied and a touch sweet. It's well made and should appeal to people who don't like their wines bone dry.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Terra d'Oro 2017 Exploration Series Viognier (California)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Perfumed aromas of flower, nectarine, lime and herb lead to lightly sweet-seeming fruit flavors. It's a well made example of the variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: TruthTeller 2017 Frolic Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Forward scents of peach, passion fruit, rose and fresh ginger are coupled with a soft warmth on the nose of this bottling. It's medium in weight on the palate, with a round, mouth-filling texture that could use a bit more lift to counter the ripe fruit tones.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Michel Gassier 2017 Les Piliers Viognier (Vin de France)

Appellation: Willcox, Arizona, US
Description: Aromas of gooseberry and white peach tinged with vanilla are joined by a whiff of spoiled tangerine. The palate is certainly round, with a pudding like weight highlighting the vanilla and creamy lemon cookie flavors, though there is enough acidity for balance.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Aridus 2015 Limited Production Viognier (Willcox)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Very floral and aromatic from the start, this opens with enticing scents of ginger-peach tea, jasmine and rose water. It's medium in weight, with a slight viscosity that lends a slick texture to the palate and final notes of muddled peach flesh.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Maison de la Villette 2017 Viognier (Vin de France)

Appellation: Colorado, Colorado, US
Description: A rich white apricot aroma wafts from the glass. The palate starts ripe, with juicy flavors of donut peach, but quickly rushes into a bitter, pithy finish with white pepper spice and spoiled clementine.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Creekside Cellars 2016 Viognier (Colorado)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Flower, white peach and crystal-clear mineral and wet stone aromas lead to a full-bodied rounded palate that shows a beautiful sense of transparency and length. Minerality is much discussed and debated. This wine is a check mark in the column for its existence.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Cayuse 2016 Cailloux Vineyard Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: This skin-fermented wine is terracotta in color, with elegant aromas of mango, marmalade, honeysuckle and dried apricot. A delicate tannic structure offers support to the concentrated fruit flavors on the palate, leading to the dry, lingering finish.                      Carrie Dykes
Name: King Family 2016 Small Batch Series Viognier (Monticello)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Quady usually makes a pair of Viogniers, but this time they combined them. Sourced from the Ox Block and Steelhead Run vineyards (hence the name), this sports lush Meyer lemon, grapefruit and white-peach flavors. A light touch of fresh herb highlights sweet toasty barrel flavors through the finish. Some 30% was barrel fermented.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Quady North 2016 Steel-Ox Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Floral in jasmine, this is a nicely put together wine, tight in firm integrated acidity. Light layers of apple and peach give it a bright succulence that belies the underlying ripeness and unctuous texture.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Kobler 2017 Marsha's Vineyard Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Citrus-driven, this wine has great juicy acidity and midweight structure, plus a vibrancy that persists in the glass. Green apple and stone fruit complete the picture.                      Virginie Boone
Name: McKahn 2017 Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Honey, apple and pear along with a sweetness of white peach characterize the bold lush flavors in this full-bodied, voluptuously textured white. Hints of ginger and lemongrass tease in the background, adding an exotic element to the whole.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Sonoma-Loeb 2016 Cold Creek Vineyard Viognier (Carneros)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a new, everyday-sipping label for Michael Larner, and this wine is extremely fresh on the nose, showing clean and crisp aromas of melon, Asian pear, apple flesh and chalk. There is great zip to the sip, with key lime at first and then more rounded flavors of orange cream and honeydew.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Earthfluence 2017 Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine, made from organic grapes by Brittany Rice-Claypool, whose family founded Sunstone Winery, starts with a nearly savory kick of aged goat cheese, saffron, nuts and dried orange peels. The palate is crisp with sunny flavors of lemon and pear, bolstered by well-integrated acid—an uncommon but intriguing Viognier.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Millésimé 2015 Le Jardin Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rounded aromas of cantaloupe and daffodil approach a buttery element on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. There is great grip and fresh acidity on the palate, where mango cream, smoke and crushed sandstone flavors arise.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bellante 2017 Jack McGinley Vineyard Viognier (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Strong flavors of crunchy apple with hints of cured meat ride along an unctuous texture in this estate-grown wine that holds its acidity well.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hawley 2017 Hawley Vineyard Viognier (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Aromas of passionfruit and overripe apples are offset by a grassy, fiddlehead fern note. On the palate, an acidic lift of lemon-lime and candied grapefruit mingle with ginger spices. This feels zesty for a Viognier and its bright nature gives it a long, refreshing finish.                      Carrie Dykes
Name: Jefferson Vineyards 2016 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Templeton Gap District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rounded aromas of melon and pear are cut by a key-lime spritz and Meyer lemon pith, and a flash of tropical bubblegum comes out as well. The palate is pretty tight at first and then come the guava and banana flavors, all held up by racy acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Barton 2017 River Clare Ranch Vineyard Viognier (Templeton Gap District)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a bottling for oak lovers, starting with aromas of smoked cantaloupe and lemon peels. That smoke element envelops the palate, where acidity lifts the lemon-and-herb-roasted-chicken flavors, which finish on caramel and pound cake.                      Matt Kettmann
Designation: Jack McGinley Vineyard New French Oak Cuvée
Name: Bellante 2017 Jack McGinley Vineyard New French Oak Cuvée Viognier (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made from a site along Petaluma Hill Road, this is an herbal, creamy and lush wine that was fermented in stainless steel and is now wrapped in good tight acidity. Lemon meringue and green-apple flavors balance each other and allow the wine to maintain lasting freshness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Ledson 2017 Grove Vineyard Viognier (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas and flavors show notes of vanilla, pear tart, flower and spice, with fruit and barrel playing off each other. There's plenty of enjoyment to be had.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Novelty Hill 2017 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: This wine displays aromas and flavors of peach, orange peel, pear drop and coconut. Round and fat in feel, this has a long, rich finish.                      Carrie Dykes
Name: Veritas 2017 Viognier (Monticello)

Appellation: Yamhill-Carlton, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: All stainless fermented, this thin, green effort shows little fruit flavor apart from tart citrus. There's a bit of lemon rind along with the juice, and despite going through 100% malolactic it's still a tart acid-driven wine.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Et Fille 2016 Deux Vert Vineyard Viognier (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Floral and tropical in aroma and flavor, this wine displays tones of elderflower, papaya and grass. It is round and mouthcoating, with a long, fruity finish.                      Carrie Dykes
Name: Jefferson Vineyards 2015 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine starts out quite reduced. Behind that are aromas of peach, apricot, Creamsicle and flower. There's a pleasing sense of weight and viscosity to the palate, without ever getting bogged down.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: K Vintners 2016 Art Den Hoed Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley, Virginia, US
Description: Aromas of pear drop, limestone and ginger spice are medium in intensity. The palate follows suit, with a bit of grassiness coming through. It's fresh and vibrant in feel, with a creamy touch.                      Carrie Dykes
Name: Flying Fox 2017 Viognier (Shenandoah Valley)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: This carries aromas of lemon-lime, ripe yellow apple, apricot and lees. The flavors echo the nose, with a hint of button mushroom. Warm in feel with ample body, the finish is long and full.                      Carrie Dykes
Name: Barboursville Vineyards 2016 Reserve Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Soft aromas of grilled peach, marzipan, ginger and acacia are pleasant on the nose and come through on the palate. Ginger and oak spice are major players for the flavors, carried by a creamy, plush feel.                      Carrie Dykes
Name: The Williamsburg Winery 2017 Wessex Hundred Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: This offers faint honeydew, chamomile and elderflower tones on the nose. The palate is similar, boasting more floral and melon flavors.                      Carrie Dykes
Name: The Williamsburg Winery 2017 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Knights Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Nutty, metallic and tropical, this estate-grown white takes on a voluptuous, unctuous texture and sweet ripeness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Lawer 2016 Betsy's Vineyard Viognier (Knights Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Floral and brimming in green apple on entry, this wine takes on a confectionery air of candied ginger and tropical mango as it opens in the glass.                      Virginie Boone
Name: MacLaren 2017 Aida Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this bottling is seriously tropical, with candied honeydew, coconut oil and guava paste. The palate is oily and also tropically heavy, with mango and banana flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bellante 2017 Camp 4 Vineyard Viognier (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Gorgeous white-blossom perfume and hints of sweet spice introduce this full-bodied Viognier. While rich and round on the palate, its pristine gooseberry and white-grapefruit flavors are fresh and invigorating. It's a juicy, vibrant wine to enjoy now–2022.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine de la Charité 2017 La Dame Blanche Viognier (Côtes du Rhône)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Shaved apple and nectarine aromas meet with a white-flower touch on the nose of this bottling, which comes from a backyard vineyard in Solvang. There is lots of zip on the tightly wound sip, which is laser-focused from the front to midpalate but opens a bit toward riper pear and apple on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Dovecote 2017 Quail Valley Vineyard Viognier (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Made by freezing the grapes prior to extraction, this dessert wine shows candied red apple, dried honeydew and a hint of tuberose on the nose. The palate is viscous but balanced by zesty acidity that penetrates deep into the finish, offering flavors of lime spritz and apple syrup.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bonny Doon 2017 Vin de Glaciere Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this bottling walks a fine line between ripe peach and more reserved elements of lemon and key lime. There is a strong stony and chalky kick to the palate, where tangy lemon-rind flavors meet with yellow apples.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Refugio Ranch 2016 Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Honeysuckle and white-grapefruit aromas perfume this fresh, aromatic sip. While dry and full in body, pristine citrus flavors lend refreshment and vibe. Enjoy this easygoing, juicy wine now–2020.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Château du Trignon 2017 Viognier (Côtes du Rhône)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Exotic aromas of yuzu, quince sorbet, peach and mandarin orange show on the intriguing nose of this bottling from the region's Rhône pioneer. That quince flavors holds strong into the palate, where it's cut by lime juice.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Zaca Mesa 2016 Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There is a great deal of restraint leveled across this bottling, starting with the tightly wound nose of apple and pear. Similar flavors play into the palate, but the sip is all about racy acidity and chalky texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Zinke 2016 White Hawk Vineyard Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Israel, Israel
Description: This wine has a nose of clementine and vanilla bean. It offers good mouthfeel, with nectarine, honeydew melon, pineapple and almond blossom flavors that finish with a touch of iodine.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: Covenant Israel 2017 Blue C Viognier (Israel)

Appellation: Sicilia, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Made entirely with Viognier, this opens with aromas of citrus and yellow stone fruit. Mirroring the nose, the straightforward enjoyable palate offers juicy apricot and grapefruit. Enjoy soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fazio 2017 Viognier (Sicilia)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Somewhat exotic aromas of wild lime and Anjou pear show on the nose of this bottling. Pink Lady apple and riper pear flavors show on the palate, which shows decent restraint for this grape, especially in a warmer region.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: MCV 2017 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Templeton Gap District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Apple skins, dried white flowers and Asian pear flesh aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers ripe apples, pears and dried orange peels.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Barton 2017 Broken Road Viognier (Templeton Gap District)

Appellation: Judean Hills, Israel
Description: Medium yellow in color, this has white melon and guava aromas. Although it is a still wine, it has a slightly effervescent feel on the tongue, with lemon, white peach and passion fruit flavors and a note of bitter almond on the finish.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: Yatir 2016 Viognier (Judean Hills)

Appellation: La Mancha, Central Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's tan color and soapy pear and red apple aromas make for a confounding start. Its soapy, yeasty pink grapefruit and grape skin flavors finish with tropical notes. While not bad, it's odd and disjointed.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Dominio de Punctum 2017 Viento Aliseo Biodynamic Viognier (La Mancha)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Part of the winery's reserve tier, this was barrel-fermented, offering a totally different set of flavors from the stainless steel-fermented Viognier. It is lush on the palate, with concentrated apple, grapefruit and papaya flavors and a buttery, toasty finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: 2Hawk 2016 Darow Series Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The winery's best white, this decadently rich wine is packed with ripe honeysuckle, Meyer lemon, orange, tangerine, peach and apricot flavors. It's a totally delicious fruit bomb to be enjoyed now–2022.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: 2Hawk 2016 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: 2Hawk does exceptionally well with its Viogniers. This one is bright and spicy, its flavors jumping agilely from citrus to apple to pineapple to mango. This is well balanced and lingering.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: 2Hawk 2017 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine wraps subtle fruity and floral flavors in a rich mouthfilling texture that feels sweet even though it's a dry wine. It has layers of light honeysuckle, vanilla and apricot that persist from the aroma through a lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Naggiar 2017 Estate Grown Root 49 Viognier (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean and well-rounded on the nose, this bottling shows ripe pear, tight banana, white flowers and a toasty warmth. There's a hint of mango tropicality on the sip, but the bright citrusy edge of lime juice and flashes of toast and wood provide balance.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Stasis 2016 Murmur Vineyard Viognier (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lightly honeyed aromas as well as honeydew meet with crushed chalk and hot sand on the nose of this bottling. The palate shows strong and fresh lemon flavors alongside a touch of cantaloupe, but remains expertly restrained throughout.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Cooper-Garrod 2016 Randall Grahm Clone Viognier (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This rather hefty and powerful white wine has plenty to explore. It offers aromas of smoke, roses and flint, flavors that are ripe like pears with a savory aspect like sliced fennel bulb and a big rounded texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bella Grace 2017 Viognier (Amador County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This take on skin-contact Viognier works, but won't be for everyone. Murky in the glass, it shows aromas of smashed honeydew, melon rind and Meyer lemon on the edges. The palate is where things get interesting, with a creamy mouthfeel delivering flavors of orange bitters, lemon rind and honeydew candies. It's a great conversation starter.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Ruby Cellars 2016 Orange Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Subtle and pleasant aromas of lemon rind, nectarine, key lime and the hint of toast show on the nose of this well restrained Viognier. There are tropical touches of guava on the sip, but the lime flavors, strong acidity and grippy texture keep it in line.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Wilson Creek 2016 Chloe Vineyard Viognier (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of pound cake, apple galette and plumeria are bound together in a tight steely frame on the nose of this bottling. There's a bright and sharp grapefruit edge to the palate but also a pastry-like warmth, but it's the high-acid that takes center stage, arising on the front of the sip and carrying deep into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Thacher 2016 Hastings Ranch Vineyard Viognier (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Enticing scents of rose, lychee, lilac and ginger-peach tea lead the nose of this pretty and highly aromatic white. The medium-weight palate is slightly slick in feel, but balanced by ample acidity and spiced orange and peach tones that remain through the close. Drink now.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Domaine de la Baume 2016 Elisabeth Viognier (Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is an austere wine with a waxy element to its texture, highlighted in fennel and grass. Fresh and high in acidity, it's flinty on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: People's Wine Revolution 2015 Salem Ranch Viognier (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Honeycomb, apple skin and light sweet-spice aromas set the scene for the nose and mouth of this medium-weight wine. The palate offers additional flavors of ripe melon flesh, while a peach-pit accent unfolds on the close. Drink now.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: La Forge Estate 2016 Viognier (Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aged in concrete and hailing from three different vineyards, this is an extremely ripe and unctuous bottling, starting with aromas of banana Jolly Rancher with a hint of grapefruit juice. The palate is extremely tropical, blending papaya, guava and banana flavors as well as a dominating coconut-oil element.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Pulchella 2017 Drifter Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is the current release, though well past its vintage. It seems flat on first sip but recoups itself with a lingering finish that reflects well-aged Viognier. Drink up.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Simple Machine 2013 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of fruit from Olsen and Red Willow vineyards, this offers aromas of orange blossom, ripe peach, toast and spice. The medium-bodied palate brings stone-fruit flavors that dip slightly in the middle, finishing bitter. This variety can be a difficult needle to thread, with this one not quite pulling it off.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Mark Ryan 2016 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: There is a lot going on in this wine, from the depth of flavors and aromas to the compelling mouthfeel. Aromas of honeydew, juniper, white peach meld with coconut, ground ginger and butter. Smooth and creamy in the mouth, this could stand up to a hearty meal. The finish is long and evolving.                      Carrie Dykes
Name: Stone Tower 2016 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This biodynamic producer excels at Viognier, and this vintage is especially succulent, with a juicy and compelling mix of stone fruit, Meyer lemon and tangerine flavors. Impeccably balanced, textured and long, with citrus rind highlights, it spent just four months in 30% new oak. Its flavors remain clean and clear all the way through a delicious finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Cowhorn 2016 Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very intriguing and unique on the nose, this richer yet not tropical take on Viognier shows banana flambé, meringue, spun sugar and peach blossom on the nose. The soft supple palate combines baked pastries, custard, cherimoya, pear and nectarine sorbet flavors, leading toward marshmallow. It is both fascinating and delicious.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Site 2015 Larner Vineyard Viognier (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Placer County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Ripe tropical fruit in the aroma, fresh clean flavors and a rich texture buoyed by good acidity make this medium-bodied wine easy to like. Barrel-fermented in mostly neutral oak, it's smooth and fairly broad on the palate, and stays nice and dry and firm on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Carol Shelton 2016 Wild Thing Damiano Vineyard Viognier (Placer County)

Appellation: Lisboa, Portugal
Description: Lightly wood aged but with its fruitiness intact, this ripe wine conveys yellow-fruit flavors. Acidity and minerality dominate the touches of toast and the creamy, vanilla texture. This rich, intense wine needs to develop. Drink from 2019.                      Roger Voss
Name: Quinta do Monte d'Oiro 2016 Madrigal Viognier (Lisboa)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Though light on the nose, there is a distinctive toasted hazelnut aromas on this bottling along with nectarine cream, brioche and citrus rind. The palate is a fuller expression yet without becoming tropical, offering toast with marmalade flavors, a lively acidity and a grippy texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Martin Ranch 2015 Therese Vineyards Viognier (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: The winery lists this as a reserve, though there doesn't appear to be any such indication on the label. The flavors are robust, penetrating and succulent, suggesting Meyer lemon, lime and pineapple.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Dominio IV 2015 Glass House Viognier (Oregon)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This barrel-fermented wine is fruity, full bodied and loaded with apple, peach and snappy grapefruit flavors. It's well balanced, ripe while keeping its alcohol in check, and framed with well-managed fruit skin flavors.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Agate Ridge 2015 Viognier (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Tropical fruits come through in abundance here, from mango and guava to peach and citrus. It's all about fresh, forward fruit and best enjoyed while it's still in the first blush of youth.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Season 2016 Viognier (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Elegant Asian pear, apple blossoms and wet stone make for a restrained take on Viognier by young winemaker Natalie Darr. It's a tad riper on the palate, with poached pear and hints of tropical fruit, but also a zesty acidity and firm chalky texture throughout.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rococo 2017 Alta Colina Vineyard Viognier (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Nagambie Lakes, Victoria, Australia
Description: A charming wine from a historic Victorian winery, the nose is perfumed in tones of ripe stone fruits, florals and sun-kissed grapes. The grape's characteristic oiliness is out in full force on the palate, but there's a good deal of acidity to cope with the weight and fruit bowl flavors. Tones of ginger and white pepper ring on the finish.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Tahbilk 2017 Estate Grown and Bottled Viognier (Nagambie Lakes)

Appellation: Yarra Valley, Victoria, Australia
Description: From one of the Yarra Valley's most historic wineries, this wine brings appealing floral and savory characters on the nose. The palate is this wine's savior: tangy, salty, nutty and oily-textured, with beautifully balanced acidity.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Yeringberg 2015 Viognier (Yarra Valley)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A tad reductive at first, this bottling shows dried lemon skins and pink grapefruit rinds, and slowly opens into a more floral experience. The palate offers warm white peach and guava notes, nicely restrained for the grape.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Le P'tit Paysan 2015 L'Apiculteur Cedar Lane Vineyard Viognier (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Floral and citrus aromas meet almond and honeysuckle flavors in this medium-bodied, full-flavored and unoaked wine. It has the palate impact of a big Chardonnay but a different array of flavors to explore.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Suveg 2016 Viognier (Lodi)

Appellation: Eden Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: This heady wine offers aromas of lychee, stone fruit and rose water, with a lovely saltiness at its core. The palate shows the variety's characteristic oily texture, with some apparent oak spice leading to a ginger and white pepper finish.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Yalumba 2016 Viognier (Eden Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: One of the winery's bottlings that form an ode to the farm crews, this wine starts with hints of honey, lemon syrup and pear skins on the nose. There is a strong vibrancy to the sip, where lime juice cuts through the ripe pear flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Sculpterra 2016 Heroe Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Eden Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: Aromas of nuts, smoke, and bread combine on the nose over tones of peach and flowers. While the palate's richness and oak flavors are on the clunky side, nevertheless, lovers of full-bodied whites will enjoy this barrel-chested style.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Yalumba 2016 The Virgilius Viognier (Eden Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of Bosc pear, fresh citrus and a pinch of chalk show on the nose of this bottling. The wine hits the palate with a riper sweetness that washes into zesty wild lime rind flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Sculpterra 2016 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: South Coast, South Coast, California, US
Description: A ripe take on an already unctuous grape, this bottling shows tuberose, lily, ripe white peach and fresh nectarine on the rich nose. The palate is also very ripe with flavors of Bosc and Anjour pear, baked apple and strong honeysuckle.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hawk Watch Winery 2017 Viognier (South Coast)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rarely does a sparkling Viognier hit the market, and it's doubtful that any could be as good as this bottling by brewer-turned-winemaker Sherman Thacher. Extremely effervescent bubbles shoot out aromas of Asian pear, lemon zest, gardenia and the slighest hint of guava tropicality. The bubbles are soft on the sip, carrying honeydew and sharp lime flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Designation: Hastings Ranch Vineyard Blanc de Blanc
Name: Thacher 2013 Hastings Ranch Vineyard Blanc de Blanc Viognier (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a 100% varietal wine fermented and aged in neutral French oak, the vines grown at 2,100-feet elevation. Viscous and floral, it's deliciously balanced, with well-defined layers of apricot, white pepper, honey and vanilla wafer.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Pride Mountain 2016 Viognier (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tightly wound aromas of yellow flowers, lemon wedges, pear flesh, beeswax and a kiss of oak show on the nose of this bottling from the vineyard formerly known as Verna's. There is great grip to the palate, with lemon oil, sandalwood and chamomile flavors, framed by a chalky structure. It offers good cellaring potential.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bonny Doon 2016 Shokrian Vineyard Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Red pear skins, poached pear flesh, white peach and a touch of caramel show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression from a winery that makes a lot of Viognier. More peach, mango, tropical fruits and pencil shavings show on the sip, which is woven together by tight tannins and a pithy grip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bellante 2016 Camp 4 Vineyard Viognier (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This full-bodied white opens with aromas of ripe apricot, butterscotch and a touch of cedar. The rich palate offers yellow peach, ripe lime and vanilla while a hazelnut note graces the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Michele Satta 2015 Giovin Re Viognier (Toscana)

Appellation: Grignan-les-Adhémar, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Exuberant notes of honeysuckle, apricot and tangerine perfume this rich, voluminous dry white. Fresh pink grapefruit and lemon flavors are concentrated and bright, enriched by silky skeins of caramel and honey that linger warmly on the finish. It's a remarkable value for a balanced, lovely Viognier.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine de Montine 2016 Viognier (Grignan-les-Adhémar)

Appellation: Mediterranée, France Other, France
Description: Fresh apricot, tangerine and yellow-apple notes abound in this silk-textured wine. Dry in style with soft, yielding acidity, it's an appealing Viognier at an irresistible price.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Marrenon 2016 Les Grains Viognier (Mediterranée)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tightly wound aromas of honeysuckle, lily and Key lime pie are fresh and crisp on the nose of this bottling by pop star Fergie and her father. The racy palate sizzles with acidity, offering bright flavors of tart lime skin and chilled apple flesh.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Ferguson Crest 2016 Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: France, France Other, France
Description: Crisp and restrained, this unusually demure Viognier offers all of the variety's fragrant tangerine and blossom notes in a package that's taut and spry. Dry and intensely mineral, it finishes with just a kiss of warmth and a lingering swirl of orange cream.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Maison Nicolas Perrin 2015 Viognier (France)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Strong honeydew aromas meet with plumeria and cold steel on the nose of this single-vineyard expression by a small family winery that's been producing since 2000. The rounded soft palate shows white-peach and poached-pear flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bellante 2016 Jack McGinley Vineyard Viognier (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Honey, candied lemon, woody earth and smoke show on the nose of this bottling. There is good energy to the sip, where flavors of lemon rind, toasted brioche, sea salt and woodsmoke show. It is a somewhat savory expression.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bellante 2015 Viognier (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Cévennes, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Delicate notes of apricot and tangerine extend from nose to finish in this dense, richly textured Viognier. It's not a deeply concentrated wine but silky and mouthfilling. The finish is just a touch nutty and warming.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine La Tour de Gâtigne 2015 Viognier (Cévennes)

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a strong sense of restraint on this cleanly made, fresh bottling, which is better than overripe and yet leaves a bit to be desired. The faintest of peach aromas on the nose lead into light flavors of nectarine and coconut on the palate, which offers decent textural grip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Boekenoogen 2016 Bell Ranch Vineyard Viognier (Monterey)

Appellation: Rhône Valley, France
Description: Perfumed notes of potpourri, dried lavender and spice accent this soft, full-bodied dry white. It's a touch muted and earthy on the palate but silky and smooth in mouthfeel. The finish is long, accented by savory tones of nut and dried citrus peel.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Clos du Père Clément 2015 Viognier

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A whiff of white flowers, then a crush of ripe fruit, and the wine opens with tangy lemon, grapefruit and peach flavors. Notes of citrus rind add depth and the acids strike just the right chord.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Amalie Robert 2016 Our Muse Viognier (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Far from simply fruity, this is a complex and sophisticated wine that shows how distinctive the grape variety can be. It relies on savory, minerally flavors that have wonderful subtlety and reserve. With each sip it settles a little deeper on the palate, lingering for a long finish buoyed by underlying acidity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lava Cap 2016 Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: In the opulent, concentrated school of thought this wonderful luxurious-tasting wine is shaped by very ripe fruit flavors and generous helpings of suave oak. Flavors run from marzipan to honeysuckle and poached pears, and a nicely viscous texture fills the mouth and helps the finish linger.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Cedarville 2016 Estate Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This is a light, appetizing style of a sometimes heavy varietal. Unique citrus and pine aromas lead to juicy, fresh and tangy flavors that range from lemon to honeysuckle. On the palate it's crisp and clean, lightly fruity and refreshing.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Steele 2016 Viognier (Lake County)

Appellation: Greyton, South Africa
Description: Soft, toasty notes of apple skin, creamed melon and orange peel greet the nose and carry through to the medium-weight palate, where they're met with additional hints of melon rind and baking spice. A pithy texture lends length to the close. Drink now.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Lismore 2015 Viognier (Greyton)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine oozes fresh fruity, floral aromas and has light bright flavors to match. Touches of honey and orange come out on the palate, where the texture feels just right between a touch of richness and liveliness.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Mount Aukum 2015 Viognier (Fair Play)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: The nose offers intense aromas of orange peel, dried apricot, marmalade and ginger, which carries to the palate along with fresh brioche. It feels creamy and round, with a supple body lending itself to a long, opulent finish.                      Carrie Dykes
Name: Keswick Vineyards 2015 Signature Series Viognier (Monticello)

Appellation: Maremma Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas of toasted oak, ripe apricot and butterscotch while the textured palate offers cedar, vanilla and lemon drop. It closes on a note of bitter almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Pinciana 2015 Viognier (Maremma Toscana)

Appellation: Maremma Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of yellow peach, citrus and a whiff of almond carry over to the medium-bodied palate. Fresh acidity gives it a bright finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattoria San Felo 2016 Viognier (Maremma Toscana)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Unusual aromas of watermelon Jolly Rancher, lime zest and white flower are followed by light flower and peach flavors that finish tart. It doesn't all come together.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Eternal 2016 Eternal Sunshine Morrison Lane Vineyard Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of watermelon Jolly Rancher, peach and flower are followed by broad honeysuckle and stone-fruit flavors. It doesn't all come together.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Watermill 2015 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Galilee, Israel
Description: Aromas of clementine and juniper berry set the scene for flavors of apricot, white peach, and almond. Offering nice mouthfeel, this wine has a touch of almond blossom on the short finish.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: Dalton 2016 Reserve Viognier (Galilee)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: This Viognier is bursting with passion fruit, honeydew, peach and elderflower aromas that carry right through to the palate. The mouthfeel is a little flimsy but there are great flavors here.                      Carrie Dykes
Name: Sunset Hills 2016 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: This wine shows mealy apple, margarine and nut aromas on the nose. The flavors are similar yet the mouthfeel is easy-going and pleasing.                      Carrie Dykes
Name: Keswick Vineyards 2016 Signature Series Viognier (Monticello)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Viognier above 16% alcohol is really pushing the boundaries of ripeness, and it results in a rather flat-tasting wine with one-dimensional fruit flavors and nothing else. Peaches and melon, with a hint of citrus rind come through, but how do you match this to food?                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Schmidt 2016 Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Viognier can turn sharp and bitter, as it hints at here. The flavors emphasize green botanicals, lime skin and pith. It's definitely on the less-than-optimal side of ripe for this difficult grape.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Whitetail Ridge 2016 Viognier (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Layers of spice, vanilla and toast are integrated from nose to palate in this elegant Condrieu. It's an unctuous, textured sip marked by silken waves of orange water, blossom and cream. The acidity is soft but lemony, lending freshness to a salty, savory hazelnut finish.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Delas Frères 2016 Clos Boucher  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Invigorating freshness sets this impeccably balanced Viognier apart in a flight of peers. Crisp yellow peach, mango and orange flavors are pristine and cutting, accented by subtle vanilla, spice and marshmallow. It's primary and fruity without restraint, yet elegantly composed in heft and body.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Château de Saint-Cosme 2014  Condrieu

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Pronounced earth tones on the first whiff dissipate with aeration to reveal a complex array of tropical fruit and floral aromas. Rich and broad on the palate, this wine offers a lavish concoction of sun-kissed tangerine, pineapple and peach flavors kissed with vanilla and spice. The finish is a touch warming but silken and expansive.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Michel & Stéphane Ogier 2014 La Combe de Malleval  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Honeycomb and marzipan accent bright tangerine and peach flavors in this delectably silken sip. It's unctuous and plush in mouthfeel but balanced firmly with sunny citrus acidity and airy plumes of violet and honeysuckle florals.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Vidal-Fleury 2014  Condrieu

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Fresh, primary notes of peach and pear are lifted by lavish orange blossom and honeysuckle perfume. This warming, plush wine is full of vanilla, cream and custard but lemony acidity and delicate spice and smoke tones maintain the finesse.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Jean-Luc Colombo 2014 Amour de Dieu  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Whiffs of orange blossom, vanilla and toast mingle enticingly on this plump but elegantly balanced Viognier. Crisp tangerine and white-peach flavors lend freshness to the midpalate. The finish is long, marked by a swirl of vanilla cream that lingers richly.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Delas Frères 2016 La Galopine  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Vanilla, honeysuckle and grapefruit are shaded in savory shades of earth, pollen and nuts in this creamy, full-bodied Viognier. It's a hefty, concentrated wine with soft acidity but hints of lemon and orange peel brighten a lingering finish.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Rémi Niero 2014 Chéry  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are subdued for the variety but intriguing, with notes of pear, ginger, wet rock and peach, along with cinnamon and light barrel spices. The palate is considerably more forward, with abundant stone-fruit flavors that show concentration and richness along with a sense of restraint.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Charles Smith 2014 Lawrence Vineyard Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas explode with notes of honeysuckle, ripe peach, apricot and creamsicle. The flavors are supremely rich but also show a beautiful sense of delicacy along with a pronounced finish. It's full bore but delicious.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: K Vintners 2015 Powerline Vineyard Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Veins of waxy orange and lemon peels freshen this full-bodied but lively Viognier. Vanilla bean and tangerine flavors are rich and silky on the palate accented by fragrant swirls of honeysuckle. The finish is a tad warming but lingers pleasantly.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Maison Denuzière 2014 Aphrodite  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Four years after bottling, the vibrance of Viognier's characteristic honeysuckle and tropical fruit are waning here, but a fascinating transformation of earth, nut and spice is taking place. Full bodied and concentrated, the palate offers muted, dustier flavors of dried orange peel and apple shaded with hints of dried herb and bramble.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Michel & Stéphane Ogier 2013 Les Vieilles Vignes  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tightly wound aromas of crisp Asian pear, pomelo pith and talcum show on the refreshing nose of this bottling. The palate is extremely grippy, fresh and texturally compelling, with racy flavors of grapefruit pith, Key lime rind and a hint of melon.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lion Ranch 2016 Viognier (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Templeton Gap District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bright aromas of melon, strawberry guava, lemon blossom, tuberose and ripe apples show on the nose of this bottling. The palate combines citrusy energy and decent tension with ripe pear and guava-cream flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Barton 2016 Broken Road Viognier (Templeton Gap District)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Broad aromas of honeydew, tuberose and guava prove quite floral and tropical, and there is a chalky backbone providing aromatic structure. Crisp, clean flavors of Juicy Fruit gum show on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: D'Alfonso-Curran 2016 Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very chalky, tightly wound and mineral-driven on the nose, this expertly restrained bottling also shows Key lime, slight white peach and a whiff of daffodil on the nose. Zippy as can be on the sip, flavors of lime and pink lemon are overshadowed by chalky tensions and limestone flavors, much like licking a white rock.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Jaffurs 2016 Bien Nacido Vineyard Viognier (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Deftly handled, this wine sidesteps the variety's characteristic heat and bitterness. Instead, it's loaded with spicy, gin-like botanical highlights and juicy, fresh lime and citrus fruit.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Dobbes Family Estate 2016 Sundown Vineyard Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: El Pomar District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fairly reserved on the nose, this bottling offers Condrieu-esque aromas of honeydew candy and creamy tropical fruits without going overripe. There's a citrusy, Key lime freshness at the tip of the sip, and then come more plush flavors of nectarine in the midpalate, finishing with a creamy texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Pomar Junction 2016 Viognier (El Pomar District)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This cool, aromatic, low-alcohol Viognier shows citrus rind and botanical scents. Lime flesh and skin flavors come through, with a core of green apple fruit. It's just underripe but well made and drinking nicely.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Iris Vineyards 2016 Steelhead Run Vineyard Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Viognier has a real chance to shine in southern Oregon, and this is proof positive. Citrus zest and lemon oil notes accent its lush orange fruit, with a hint of baby aspirin. The finish keeps the grape's propensity to turn hot and bitter in check.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Weisinger 2015 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's aroma brings light notes of honey, brown sugar and herb. The flavors are sweet and elegant. It's a light, pleasing affair.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: 14 Hands 2016 The Reserve Late Harvest Viognier (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Brown sugar, flower, pineapple and sugared peach aromas lead to sweet, elegant fruit flavors in this wine. There's some intrigue, but it doesn't all come together.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Designation: The Parting Glass Outlook Vineyard Cordon Cut
Name: Owen Roe 2015 The Parting Glass Outlook Vineyard Cordon Cut Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Clean if rather ripe aromas of peach, bubblegum and banana show on the nose of this bottling, which displays expert restraint from a warm region for an often blousy variety. There's a rich custardy touch at first on the sip, with plumeria and guava flavors, but then the chalky texture reins it back.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Falkner 2016 Viognier (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Relatively light and delicate on the nose, this bottling shows chalk, ripe pear and the unmistakable aroma of banana-flavored Now & Laters candy. The palate is tightly wound yet tropical, with papaya, mango and ripe peach flavors, each more expressive as the wine warms.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: LXV 2016 Summer Satine Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This was harvested at low brix and fermented principally in French oak. It's a soft, floral take on Viognier, with scents and flavors that suggest baby powder. Because of its Meyer lemon and other candied citrus notes, odds are either a small amount of Gewürztraminer was blended in or some residual sugar remains, though neither is indicated. Drink now and over the next two to three years.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Reustle 2016 Viognier (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's peach Jolly Rancher and white flower aromas lead to lightly sprizty, off-dry stone fruit flavors. It shows a good bit of heat on the finish, throwing the balance out of whack.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Maryhill 2016 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Bennett Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fragrant, floral and pretty in every way, this wine is also meaty in intense texture and beauty, with a bold beguiling entry that mellows on the midpalate. Balanced acidity supports notes of honey, honeysuckle and pear, with a bite of green apple on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Flanagan 2016 Viognier (Bennett Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Aromatic fruit and floral notes join delicious honeydew melon flavors as this full-bodied wine wraps around the tongue, leaving a soft smooth impression and lingering on the finish. Very good concentration, layers of flavor and that lasting finish lift this wine above the ordinary.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Workman Ayer 2015 Abroachment Viognier (Lodi)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rich but not overly tropical on the nose, this bottling shows buttered nectarine and a touch of honeydew on the nose. The palate is expertly wound up, with bright tangerine, ripe melon and creamy cherimoya, all reined in by a wet cement-like texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Zaca Mesa 2015 Estate Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light in color, this bottling offers tight, bright and plump aromas of peach and lime pith. Lime candy and citrus pop on the palate, giving life to ripe Asian pear flavors that ride a grippy texture all the way into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Workman Ayer 2016 Ipso Facto Viognier (Central Coast)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Intriguing aromas of earth, roasted almonds, beeswax and ghee prove almost mead-like on the nose of this twist-top single-vineyard bottling by Larry Schaffer. The tightly wound palate is more restrained and familiar for the variety, offering honeyed pear and citrus peel flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Tercero 2014 White Hawk Vineyard Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Alentejano, Portugal
Description: The wine is soft, rich, and full of generous yellow fruits that are layered with wood. It is spicy and ripe, with acidity to match the generous opulent fruits. Delicious, rich and full bodied, the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2014 Amantis Reserva Viognier (Alentejano)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: White blossoms and wet stone softly caress on the nose. The flavors are layered and compelling, starting on crisp green apple, honeydew melon and peach, folding into complexities of crushed stone, fennel and pollen. Well-balanced, fresh acidity and ample body lend to a long, evolving finish.                      Carrie Dykes
Name: Barboursville Vineyards 2015 Reserve Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From one of the Riboli family's new estate vineyards, this bottling is a clean but quite ripe style of Viognier, with blousy aromas of tuberose, coconut and guava. It's tighter on the palate, with honeydew, key lime and guava sorbet flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: San Simeon 2016 Stefano Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A hint of pink in the color and effusive floral and honey flavors make this richly textured and unbaked wine stand out. It has ripe pear, jasmine and melon nuances and an almost thick mouth feel.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Rock Wall 2016 Kristen's Viognier (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: A pronounced herb and spice aroma continues in the flavors of this full-bodied and mouth-filling wine. It has a soothing viscosity that carries the spicy grassy notes in a harmonious way.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Mt. Konocti Winery 2016 Viognier (Lake County)

Appellation: Upper Galilee, Israel
Description: This wine offers clean aromas of freshly-peeled clementine. Flavors of white peach, apricot, quince and a pleasing bouquet of flowers offer a nice interplay on the tongue, with smooth tannins that continue into the slightly chalky finish.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: Galil Mountain 2014 Yiron Vineyard Viognier (Upper Galilee)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Varietally correct aromas of cured ham, honeysuckle blossom and orange peel are fair and solid. This is a bit flat in feel, without much zest or snap. Flavors of green banana and lightly bitter green fruits fall off quickly on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Siegel 2016 Special Reserve Viognier (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: These biodynamic grapes, fermented with native yeasts, spent three months in 40% new French oak. It's built like a precision watch, ticking off complete and balanced varietal flavors of citrus rind and juice, with light touches of fresh herb, lemon verbena and a delicate hint of vanilla.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Cowhorn 2015 Reserve Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Concentrated and rich in flavor and creamy in texture, this wine has a big profile without seeming overtly fruity or oaky. The mouthfeel is lush, broad and quietly powerful, while subtle pear and marzipan flavors coat the palate and linger on the finish. It makes a grand impression and is “meaty” enough to serve with poultry or even beef. Winemaker Tracy Hart used no oak or stainless steel, fermenting and aging the wine in food-grade polyethylene FlexTanks.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Le Mulet Rouge 2016 Estate Viognier (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Apricot, peach, orange blossom and honey flavors all come together in this ultrasmooth, ripe but well-balanced wine. Zingy acidity blends with the rich fruitiness to keep it lively and refreshing, even while the viscosity coats the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Paskett 2016 Viognier (Lodi)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a luscious wine with a smooth and hearty mouthfeel, ample ripe fruit reminiscent of pears and white peaches, and vanilla and honey accents on both the nose and palate. Fermented in neutral barrels, it doesn't have oaky flavors but feels soft in acidity and seems to melt in the mouth.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Cedarville 2015 Estate Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine's clean lines of honey, chamomile, Gala apple and ripe Asian pear grow more tropical the longer it breathes. Its medley of flavors includes candied lemon, white peach syrup and melon, but a honey-laced chamomile tea note comes out strongest.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Peachy Canyon 2016 Concrete Blanc Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Lighter and livelier than typical California Viognier, this has crisp apple and citrus aromas, nicely tangy fruit flavors and relatively light body. It feels juicy but lean rather than rich, in a refreshing alternative style.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Feist 2016 Viognier (Fair Play)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of butterscotch, pear, peach, flowers and spice are followed by full-bodied stone-fruit flavors. It brings a fair amount of heat along with it but is certainly varietally correct.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Waterbrook 2016 ICON Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: While very fruity, fresh and ripe tasting, this medium-bodied wine also has good acidity for balance. Light touches of vanilla, butter and nutmeg add welcome complexity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Oak Grove 2016 Family Reserve Viognier (California)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas seem a bit off, with volatile notes along with lees, orange peel and peach. The palate is lightly creamy but still somewhat lean in style, not able to hold all of the flavors together.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Bontzu 2016 Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light honeydew and gardenia aromas show on the pleasant and clean nose of this well-restrained Viognier. The sip is as zippy and persistent with acidity as can be without losing the varietal character, allowing the ripe Gala apple and Anjou pear to show through the racy frame.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Asuncion Ridge 2016 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A 100% varietal wine, this is dry and in balance, made in a bigger fuller style that presents as lush and plush on the palate. Apricot and peach offer a ripe succulence of fruit as a touch of oak integrates well into the background.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Stags' Leap Winery 2016 Viognier (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Golden in the glass, this bottling shows intriguing aromas of dried lemon peels, scratched grapefruit, blood orange rinds, crushed chalk, sea salt and a touch of peach custard. The palate offers a touch of limestone minerality with seared orange, warm chamomile and vanilla toward the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Black Ridge 2013 Estate Viognier (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light in the glass, this bottling shows peach, melon, apple and key lime pith, which cuts through the riper elements. A simmering acidity is ever present on the sip, hewing the tropical guava flavors and providing a refreshing tension.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rideau 2016 Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Yellow peach, lemon, Asian pear and citrus peels show on the nose of this bottling by Matt Villard. It's very light and reserved on the palate, which is what makes it refreshing, with flavors of ripe nectarine, pan-seared apple and cider. A sizzle of acidity runs through it.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: MCV 2016 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Honeysuckle, lemongrass and wheat ride a robust wave of ripeness and bold texture in this white wine, which is exuberant in bright lemon-laced acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hawley 2016 Viognier (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is lovely in aromatics of honeysuckle, as dense compact layers of ripe apricot highlight a full-bodied profile of concentrated flavor.                      Virginie Boone
Name: McKahn 2016 Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Bright melon and lime zest aromas lead to lightly sweet, broad, fleshy fruit flavors in this wine. It's not entirely representative of the variety but still brings a lot of freshness and appeal.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Kestrel 2016 Falcon Series Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Stainless-steel fermented, this wine is made from grapes grown in Paso Robles and Lodi and is intensely concentrated. Pretty aromatics of honeysuckle open up before thick rich layers of lushly ripe peach flavor ride in.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Miner 2016 Viognier (California)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Faint white flower, orange peel, spice and citrus aromas are followed by broad fruit flavors in this wine, which lacks concentration.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Novelty Hill 2015 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crisp and clean yet very tropical and ripe on the nose, this bottling shows strong guava and mango perfume notes. The palate also rides the guava wave, with touches of bubblegum, coconut and white-flower syrup.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Eberle 2016 Mill Road Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)
